Course Title: BA (Hons) Business Management, Supply Chain and Logistics
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement:
For 2024 entry, typical requirements include 112-120 UCAS points, A Levels (BBB-BBC), T Level (Merit), BTEC (DMM), GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or an Access to HE Diploma.  For 2025 entry, requirements are 112 UCAS points, A Levels (BBC), T Level (Merit), BTEC (DMM), GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or an Access to HE Diploma.  Contextual offers may apply to students who are care experienced, estranged from their families, refugees or asylum seekers, or whose parents/carers are in the UK armed forces.  

For Pakistan, undergraduate entry requires A-levels or IB from Pakistan International Schools. Postgraduate entry requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2, or a 4-year Bachelor's with honours and a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00. Students with 2 or 3-year Bachelor's degrees also need a Master's degree. PhD entry requires a Master's and Bachelor's degree in a relevant subject, along with a research proposal.
Duration: 3 years (4 years with optional placement year)
Overview: The BA (Hons) Business Management, Supply Chain and Logistics degree at the University of Derby provides a comprehensive education in business management with a specialization in supply chain and logistics.  The program is designed to equip students with the theoretical knowledge and practical skills necessary for success in this rapidly expanding field.  Students will gain a strong foundation in core business disciplines such as economics, finance, HR, and marketing,  followed by an in-depth exploration of supply chain and logistics principles and practices.  The curriculum integrates real-world applications through simulations, case studies, employer-led projects and opportunities for placement years and internships.  The course also boasts accreditation from the Chartered Management Institute (CMI) and the Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport (CILT). The emphasis is strong on developing ethical and responsible business leadership skills.
Course Structure: The course begins with foundational modules covering core business areas. Year two introduces specialized supply chain and logistics topics. Students are offered choices to continue specialization, to choose another specialism such as Entrepreneurship, HRM, or Marketing, or take a more general route. There's a focus on practical application with real-world projects, case studies, simulations, and interactions with businesses like DHL, JCB, and Clipper. The optional placement year enhances employability and allows the application of knowledge. International perspectives are introduced throughout the course.  Later years offer in-depth study of areas such as sustainable supply chains, international supply chain management and effective asset management. Assessment is mainly coursework-based, including essays, reports, projects, presentations, and more. Students receive personalized academic tutoring for support.
Year 1: The first year provides a broad foundation in business management principles.  Students will cover fundamental topics in areas like economics, accounting, finance, marketing, human resource management, and organizational behavior.  The modules introduce key concepts and theories in business, providing a solid groundwork for more specialized modules in later years.  Students also receive training in vital business skills like communication, teamwork, critical thinking, and problem-solving. This year lays the groundwork for the more specialized approach to business undertaken in the later years of study.
Year 2: The second year builds upon the foundational knowledge from the first year, allowing students to delve into the specialized area of supply chain and logistics. Core modules will cover the critical elements of supply chain management, exploring topics such as inventory management, logistics operations, transportation planning, and supply chain risk management. An option to take an exchange program at collaborating institutions adds an international exposure and global perspective to the course.  Students can choose to continue with the specialism or transfer. An option to include a summer internship is made available for career experience.
Year 3: In the third year, students deepen their understanding of supply chain and logistics through advanced modules covering areas such as lean manufacturing, sustainable supply chains, international supply chain management, and technology's impact on the industry.  The emphasis is on applying knowledge and engaging in projects. Students will complete a significant project or dissertation, showcasing their capabilities and providing practical experience.
Year 4: The fourth year (optional placement year) involves a year-long work placement where students gain practical experience in a real-world business environment. This is a valuable opportunity to apply their knowledge, build their professional network, and enhance their CV in preparation for their future careers. Students will work closely with mentors to hone their skills and build their experience.

Course Title: BA (Hons) Business Management, Supply Chain and Logistics with Placement Year
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points, A Levels BBC, T Level Merit, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or an Access to HE Diploma.  International students will need to meet specified English language requirements (IELTS 6.0 with at least 5.5 in each skill).  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or IB from International Schools in Pakistan, entry to the first year is possible. Contextual offers may also apply to students meeting certain criteria.  Postgraduate entry from Pakistani universities requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to at least a UK 2:1 or 2:2, plus a Master's degree if the Bachelor's was two or three years. A four-year Bachelor's degree with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognised Pakistani University is also considered.
Overview: The BA (Hons) Business Management, Supply Chain and Logistics with Placement Year is a four-year undergraduate program focusing on equipping students with the skills necessary for success in business management, particularly within the dynamic fields of supply chain and logistics.  The course emphasizes practical learning, integrating theoretical knowledge with real-world experiences through placements, internships, consultancy projects, and field trips. Students gain a solid foundation in core business areas such as economics, finance, HR, and marketing, while developing expertise in supply chain and logistics management in later years. The program also emphasizes responsible business leadership, incorporating discussions on ethical considerations and sustainability. The course is accredited by the Chartered Management Institute (CMI) and Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport (CILT), providing additional professional qualifications and enhancing career prospects.
Course Structure: The curriculum spans four years, with the first year providing a comprehensive introduction to core business management principles. Subsequent years delve deeper into supply chain and logistics management, incorporating practical components and real-world applications.  Modules cover topics such as managing business assets, sustainable supply chain creation, international supply chain principles, and the impact of global events on these systems. Students will enhance their skills through coursework including essays, reports, group projects, presentations, business simulations, and employer-led projects. A notable aspect is a live consultancy project where students assist businesses in improving performance. They'll also benefit from expert mentorship, guest lectures, and networking opportunities.
Year 1: The first year lays a solid foundation in fundamental business management principles, covering core subjects such as economics, finance, accounting, marketing, and human resource management. This foundational year equips students with critical understanding and analytical abilities before tackling more focused logistics and supply chain modules in subsequent years.
Year 2: Building upon the first-year foundation, the second year introduces more specialized modules directly related to supply chain and logistics management. Key topics include supply chain strategy, operations management, logistics network design, and inventory control. Students begin to apply theoretical knowledge through practical exercises, case studies, and projects, enhancing problem-solving and analytical skills. An optional exchange week in Barcelona at the EU Business School is also offered.
Year 3: Year three is highlighted by a placement year, providing invaluable practical experience in a real-world setting.  This immersive experience allows students to apply what they have learned and build valuable professional contacts. This is also when they'll be heavily involved in the live consultancy project, working on real-world problems for established companies. Once the placement is complete, they return for their final year.
Year 4: The final year focuses on integrating acquired knowledge into sophisticated analyses and strategic decision-making within supply chain and logistics. Students may explore advanced topics including sustainable supply chains, technological advancements in the field, risk management, and international trade regulations. The year culminates in a major project, allowing students to showcase their integrated learning and problem-solving abilities.  This year also integrates several CMI modules.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: Entry requirements include an HND or Foundation degree in a relevant subject and at least five GCSEs (or equivalent), including Maths and English at grade 4/C or above. A transcript of previously studied modules is needed to ensure compatibility with the top-up program.  For Pakistani students, A-levels or the International Baccalaureate (IB) from Pakistani International Schools allow entry to the first year of a Bachelor's degree.  Those with a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized Pakistani university equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class degree are also eligible. Students with a two or three-year Bachelor's degree will need a Master's degree. Students with a four-year Bachelor's degree with honors should have a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00.
Annual Tuition Fee: £9,535 per year (Full-time), £1,190 per 20 credit module (Part-time)  for UK students; £16,900 per year (Full-time), N/A (Part-time) for International students.
Overview: The University of Derby's BA (Hons) Business Management (Top-Up) is a one-year full-time or two-year part-time program designed for students who have already completed an HND or foundation degree. This top-up degree allows students to gain a full honors degree by building on their existing knowledge.  The program focuses on the practical application of business management principles, utilizing case studies, simulations, and real consultancy projects.  Students will cover global and strategic management issues, specializing in areas like management, leadership, and marketing. Optional modules cater to individual interests and career goals. The program includes guest speakers from industry, emphasizing practical skills, critical thinking, and the development of self-learning and teamwork abilities.  Internationally-minded projects expose students to different cultural business approaches. Personal Academic Tutoring provides personalized academic guidance and career support throughout the program.
Course Structure: The course is structured to provide a comprehensive understanding of business management principles.  It incorporates a blend of theoretical learning and practical application through case studies, simulations, real-world consultancy projects, and guest speakers. Students will learn about different aspects of business management, including strategic management, operations, marketing, human resources, and finance. Alongside core modules, optional modules allow for specialization.  Throughout the course, students will develop essential skills in critical thinking, problem-solving, teamwork, and communication. Assessment is primarily through practical coursework assignments that mirror real-world workplace tasks, such as business reports, research projects, presentations, and design of digital materials. A significant component is a Business Consultancy Project in Stage 3, which involves solving a real problem for a business, offering valuable practical experience and enhancing employability.
Year 1: NA
Year 2: NA
Year 3: The third year, or Stage 3, is the final year for a full-time student.  It includes core modules expanding on areas like strategic management, leadership, and marketing, and incorporates the Business Consultancy Project, a significant practical experience where students apply their skills to real-business problems. The selected modules, some optional, help build expertise in areas relevant for career destinations. Students also benefit from interactions with various guest speakers from varied industry roles.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112-120 UCAS points, A Levels BBB-BBC, T Level Merit, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/Grade C or above, or equivalent qualifications.  An Access to HE Diploma is also accepted with 60 credits (45 at Level 3). Contextual offers may apply to care experienced students, those estranged from their families, refugees or asylum seekers, or students whose parents/carers are in the UK armed forces.  For Pakistan, A-levels or IB from Pakistani international schools allow direct entry into Year 1. Postgraduate entry for Pakistani students requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2, potentially including a Master's degree if the Bachelor's is two or three years long. A four-year Bachelor's with a minimum 2.4/4.0 GPA is also considered. PhD applicants must have a Master's and Bachelor's and submit a research proposal.
Annual Tuition Fee: UK: £9,535 per year; International: £16,900 per year
Overview: The BA (Hons) Business Management and Accounting is a three-year, full-time joint honours degree program offered by the University of Derby. This course offers a comprehensive education in both business management and accounting principles, providing students with the expertise needed to succeed in various business roles. The curriculum combines theoretical frameworks with real-world applications through industry projects, links with international partners, and optional placement years.  Students can tailor their studies by selecting optional modules covering areas like logistics, human resource management, marketing, enterprise, and finance, aligning their learning with personal career aspirations. This program is accredited by the Chartered Management Institute (CMI), granting students an additional professional qualification and access to CMI member benefits, thereby significantly enhancing their employability. The program also uses a state-of-the-art Financial Markets Lab, where students utilize industry-standard tools and technologies.
Course Structure: The course structure combines modules from both Business Management and Accounting. Year one typically focuses on foundational aspects across both disciplines. Subsequent years offer more specialized options. Students may choose to focus on one chosen area of study in years two and three, selecting optional modules aligned with their career goals. The program culminates in a final assessment evaluating students' acquired knowledge and skills.  The curriculum is designed to build practical skills through hands-on projects, case studies, and collaborative work, fostering professional development and industry-relevant competencies.
Year 1: The first year provides a foundational understanding of business management and accounting principles. Students will be introduced to core concepts such as financial accounting, management accounting, organizational behavior, business law and introductory marketing. A combination of lectures, seminars, and practical exercises ensures a balanced theoretical and practical learning experience. This year is essential in providing a strong base for the specialized modules of subsequent years.
Year 2: Year two allows for more specialization.  While continuing to build upon fundamental knowledge, students will be expected to take a larger number of optional modules aligned with their chosen specialization within business management or accounting, or take more modules in an even spread for both disciplines. Students can choose from a range of subjects such as financial management, auditing, human resource management, marketing management, and operations management, strengthening their skill set. This more specialized curriculum prepares students for advanced studies in later years and future career prospects.
Year 3: The third year typically involves a mix of advanced modules in the chosen specialization while building further capability in both business management and accounting. Students will engage in more complex projects, case studies, and potentially a placement year.  The optional placement year, integrated between the second and third years, allows students to gain valuable hands-on experience and boost their employability.  The final year also includes preparation for final assessments, showcasing their accumulated knowledge and skills through various assessment methods like examinations, coursework, and presentations.

Course Title: Bachelor of Arts (Hons) in Business Management and Business Technology
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2024 entry, typical requirements include 112-120 UCAS points, A Levels (BBB-BBC), BTEC (DDM-DMM), GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or a Pass Access to HE Diploma.  For 2025 entry, requirements are 112 UCAS points, A Levels (BBC), BTEC (DMM), and GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above. Contextual offers may be available for students meeting specific criteria such as being care experienced, estranged from their families, refugees, asylum seekers, or having parents/carers in the UK armed forces.  International students will need to meet the IELTS requirement.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or IB from international schools in Pakistan, entry to the first year is possible.
Overview: The BA (Hons) Business Management and Business Technology degree at the University of Derby blends business principles with the application of IT.  Students gain a practical understanding of how technology supports business operations, developing analytical and problem-solving skills highly valued by employers.  The curriculum covers key business concepts, encompassing responsible management, business ethics, analytics, digital media, innovation, and globalization.  A focus on the commercial management of IT and strategic importance of business analytics sets this program apart, preparing graduates for success in diverse business roles. The course is accredited by the Chartered Management Institute (CMI), leading to a CMI professional qualification upon graduation.  The program involves various learning methods, including lectures, seminars, tutorials, work experience, consultancy projects, and optional placements. A major component is the final-year Business Consultancy Project, where students apply their skills to solve real-world business problems.  The university offers comprehensive support through a Personal Academic Tutoring program, guiding students' academic journey and career planning.
Course Structure: The course begins with common modules in the first year, forming a foundation in business principles common across other Business Management specialisms at Derby. Subsequent years then specialize in Business Management and Business Technology, incorporating modules that allow students to gain experience, and potentially work with international students on joint projects.  The curriculum will contain a blend of theoretical studies and practical applications, including work experience and a final year consultancy project. Students are actively encouraged to engage in self-directed learning to enhance understanding and skill proficiency.  Throughout the degree, there's a consistent focus on the management concepts that are reinforced within a technological context. This structure enables the students to understand how to integrate technology into day-to-day business operations.
Year 1: The first year provides a foundation in core business principles common to all Business Management degrees at the University of Derby.  Students will be introduced to key concepts in management, developing fundamental understanding in areas such as business ethics, responsible management practices, and an introduction of how IT impacts business and business strategy.  This foundational year establishes a strong basis for further specialization in subsequent years.  Students gain exposure to the use of data for decision making and introductory elements of accounting and finance, which will be important for later specialization.
Year 2: The second year builds upon the foundational year, delving deeper into specialized areas of Business Management and Business Technology. Students will expand their knowledge of business analytics with greater emphasis on interpreting data to make informed decisions.  Specific learning will include various software solutions for business analysis, and the strategic implications of data-driven insights for various business decision-making scenarios. Further development of both practical and theoretical aspects of business technology will be a considerable focus, with an increasing amount of group work and coursework reflecting real-world business contexts.
Year 3: The final year integrates all previously acquired knowledge and skills through a significant Business Consultancy Project.  Students, working individually or in small groups, tackle a real-world business challenge for an external organization, enhancing their practical problem-solving abilities.  Modules will focus on advanced business analytics techniques, strategic decision-making frameworks, and the application of IT in achieving business goals.  This culminates in a comprehensive final project showcasing their understanding of the field.

Overview: The University of Derby's Business Management and Business Technology BA (Hons) with Placement Year is a three-year undergraduate program designed to equip students with practical business and IT skills.  The curriculum blends theoretical knowledge with real-world application, covering core business concepts such as responsible management, business ethics, analytics, digital media, innovation, and globalization. Students develop a strong understanding of how IT supports business operations and decision-making, while also enhancing their analytical and problem-solving abilities. A unique feature is the integrated placement year, providing valuable hands-on experience in a professional setting.  This program is accredited by the Chartered Management Institute (CMI), offering a dual qualification upon graduation. The first year lays the foundation for business management principles. Subsequent years build upon this base, with specializations and modules tailored to the Business Management and Business Technology pathway. The program also offers additional activities such as joint projects with overseas students and opportunities for optional international trips (part-funded).  CMI membership and registration for a Level 5 Diploma are included in the fees.
Year 1: The first year provides a broad foundation in core business management concepts.  Students will be introduced to principles of management, organizational behavior, accounting, economics, and potentially introductory modules related to technology's role in business. This year serves as a common base across different business management degree pathways at the university, allowing flexibility for specialization in later years.
Year 2: The second year deepens the understanding of business management principles.  Students will likely explore areas such as marketing, operations management, human resource management, and more advanced topics relevant to the chosen specialization.  Students might also undertake modules which focus on specific aspects of business technology and the intersection between business and IT systems. This year will build upon the fundamental knowledge established in the prior year.
Year 3: The third year focuses on specialization in Business Management and Business Technology allowing students to delve into advanced topics within their pathway.  Students will engage in the optional placement year, allowing real-world application of acquired skills and building practical experience.  The final year culminates in the Business Consultancy Project, providing students with the opportunity to apply research and problem-solving techniques to a real industry challenge.

Course Title: Undergraduate Criminology and Business Management BA/BSc (Hons)

Overview: The Criminology and Business Management BA/BSc (Hons) Joint Honours degree at the University of Derby offers a unique blend of criminological theory, policy, and practice alongside core business principles.  Students explore responsible management, business ethics, innovation, and globalization. The program emphasizes practical learning through real-world applications and connections with the business community.  Criminology modules cover relevant concepts, theories, methods, and skills within the criminal justice system. The course includes opportunities for work placements, allowing students to apply knowledge and gain practical experience.
Course Structure: The course involves a combination of Criminology and Business Management modules. Students initially study both subjects equally in the first year before choosing to major or minor in one subject or continue studying both equally in subsequent years.  Assessment methods vary and include exams, coursework, presentations, case studies, and practical business-oriented work such as marketing plans. The modules themselves are subject to change and are updated regularly to improve the student experience and graduate prospects. The Chartered Management Institute accreditation is available to those who meet specific criteria within the program.
Year 1: The first year provides a foundational understanding of both Criminology and Business Management. Students will be introduced to core concepts, theories, and methodologies within each discipline, allowing for a balanced exploration of both fields. Early-stage modules will provide the groundwork for specialization in the following years.
Year 2: In the second year, students can tailor their studies based on their chosen pathway, whether it be a major or minor in Criminology or Business Management or continuing with an equal focus on both. Specific module choices will depend on this pathway selection. Students will build upon the foundation laid in the first year with more advanced modules in their chosen subjects.
Year 3: The third year sees students focus on more specialized topics and build upon their foundation from the earlier years. Depending on the selected pathway, the modules in year three will be centered around advanced knowledge within the chosen major and minor, enabling a more in depth understanding and application of the chosen specializations. This year also emphasizes either further practical application or advanced research opportunities.

Course Title: Undergraduate Business Management and Economics BA (Hons)
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points, A Levels BBC, T Level Merit, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or an Access to HE Diploma pass with specific credit requirements.  International students need an IELTS score of 6.0 with at least 5.5 in each skill.  For Pakistani students, A-levels or IB from Pakistani international schools allow entry into Year 1.  Postgraduate entry from Pakistan requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2, potentially including a Master's degree if the Bachelor's is two or three years. Overview: The University of Derby's Business Management and Economics BA (Hons) is a three-year undergraduate joint honors program designed to equip students with a strong foundation in both business management and economics. The curriculum emphasizes practical application, using real-world case studies, industry projects, and potential placement years to bridge theoretical frameworks with practical experience.  Students can tailor their studies with optional modules in areas like logistics, human resource management, marketing, enterprise, and finance, aligning their education with career aspirations. The course is accredited by the Chartered Management Institute (CMI), providing an additional professional qualification in management and leadership.  Graduates will be well-prepared for various career paths across multiple industries.
Course Structure: The course begins with equal study of both business management and economics in the first year. Students then choose to either continue with equal weighting or choose to major or minor in one of the subjects for Years 2 and 3.  The curriculum includes lectures, seminars—both tutor-led and student-led— tutorials, work projects, and self-directed study, supported by the university's online learning portal.  Assessment methods involve a mix of practical coursework such as business reports, research projects, presentations, and computer-based assessments, along with data analysis and quantitative methods using software such as Bloomberg, Excel, and SPSS.
Year 1: The first year provides a foundation in both Business Management and Economics, introducing core concepts and theories in each subject. Students will gain an understanding of fundamental business principles, economic theories, and their interrelation.  They will likely cover aspects of micro and macroeconomic theory,  some accounting principles, and fundamental aspects of business operations, including but not limited to marketing, finance, and operations management.  Modules are likely spread throughout the year, culminating in coursework and examinations testing their acquired knowledge and application skills.
Year 2: In the second year, students will build on the foundational knowledge from the first year and move toward further specialization within Business Management and/or Economics— depending on student choice of major/minor.  Further modules will likely include more specialized topics in either or both disciplines, depending on the student's decision.  Advanced quantitative and analytical techniques will be introduced and applied, as will more intricate business case studies and project work.  This year focuses on strengthening analytical skills and practical application, including the use of specific software used in business and economics for data analysis.
Year 3: The third year allows students to deepen their understanding of their chosen major, while still engaging with related topics in the  minor subject.  Involvement in major projects,  potentially a placement year, and a final-year dissertation or project is likely included in this year. depending upon the student choice this will involve further practical application of knowledge and skills relevant to their chosen career path.  Opportunities for networking and career development are also increased during this year.

Overview: The University of Derby's BA (Hons) Business Management and English is a three-year joint honours program that blends business principles with literary and cultural studies. Students can choose a major or minor subject or study both equally after the first year.  The curriculum incorporates practical business assignments and engages students in in-depth literary analysis, fostering versatile skillsets. The course aims to equip graduates for various career paths.
Course Structure: The course integrates Business Management and English modules. The first year involves equally weighted studies in both subjects.  After completing the first year students select to focus on one subject as a major and the other as a minor or to continue studying both equally. Business Management modules often involve practical coursework, such as reports, projects, and presentations, while English modules emphasize analysis, interpretation, presentations, and research-based projects. Optional modules allow students to tailor the program towards specific interests.
Year 1: The first year provides a foundational understanding of both Business Management and English. Business modules introduce core business principles and practices, with an emphasis on practical application. English modules cover foundational literary theory and equip students with critical analysis skills through examining diverse literature.
Year 2: In the second year, students refine their chosen focus, major or minor. Business Management may incorporate more specialized modules like marketing or human resources, while English modules provide deeper literary study, perhaps focusing on specific genres or authors.  Students may also undertake a placement year at this stage.
Year 3: The third year allows for advanced study in students' chosen focus.  Business Management students may engage in projects simulating real-world business challenges or undertake consulting projects.  English students delve further into research, potentially producing significant research papers or dissertations.  The focus remains on skills enhancement and application of knowledge to future career paths.

Course Title: Undergraduate Business Management and Entrepreneurship BA (Hons)

Overview: The University of Derby's BA (Hons) Business Management and Entrepreneurship program is a dynamic undergraduate degree designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge needed for success in the business world. The course combines business management principles with an entrepreneurial focus, allowing students to develop creativity, flexibility, innovation, and problem-solving skills.  Students will learn how to identify and progress viable commercial ideas, launching their own ventures or impressing potential employers. The curriculum includes practical experience through work-related learning, live projects, case studies, and business simulations, providing a global perspective on business and emphasizing ethical and responsible management.  A unique feature of the program is its CMI accreditation, providing a route to gaining a CMI Level 5 Diploma alongside the degree, fostering networking opportunities and career development. It also offers a placement year option between years two and three, enhancing practical experience and employability.
Course Structure: The course follows a structured curriculum, beginning with foundational modules in the first year to provide a broad understanding of core business disciplines.  Students then choose a specialization pathway, including Entrepreneurship, HRM, Marketing, Finance, Business Technology, or Supply Chain and Logistics, or opt for the core Business Management route with a broader skillset developed from optional modules.  The curriculum includes a blend of theoretical learning, practical workshops and simulation exercises, presentations, case studies and live projects. Year 4: The final year of study integrates prior knowledge to further develop specialized knowledge  and practical skills in a business setting. It might involve capstone projects, dissertation work, or final year projects that often focus on specific areas of sustainable practice, requiring independent research, problem-solving, and the creation of a unique deliverable related to the course.  It is likely that this year will finalize the specialization chosen in year 3.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2024 entry, typical entry requirements include 112-120 UCAS points, A Levels (BBB-BBC), a Merit in T Levels, DMM in BTECs, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/Grade C or above, or a Pass in an Access to HE Diploma. For 2025 entry, requirements are 112 UCAS points, A Levels (BBC), a Merit in T Levels, DMM in BTECs, and GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/Grade C or above.  Contextual offers may be made to students who are care experienced, estranged from their families, refugees or asylum seekers, or whose parents/carers are in the UK armed forces.  For undergraduates from International schools in Pakistan with A-levels or IB, direct entry into Year 1 is possible.
Overview: The University of Derby's Business Management BA (Hons) is a three-year undergraduate program designed to equip students with practical skills and theoretical knowledge in business management.  The curriculum covers contemporary business topics such as responsible management, business ethics, business analytics, digital media, innovation, and globalization. Students engage in varied learning methods including lectures, seminars, tutorials, work experience, and projects. They'll also participate in real-world scenarios through consultancy projects, placements, and internships, applying their knowledge to solve actual business problems.  The program emphasizes developing crucial skills such as agility, innovation, resilience, and teamwork. The integrated learning approach also features collaborative projects with international partner universities, promoting cross-cultural understanding in global business contexts.  Upon successful completion, graduates receive a BA (Hons) degree and a CMI professional qualification.
Course Structure: The course combines theoretical learning with practical application. The first year provides a foundation in core business principles. Subsequent years allow specialization through various pathways, including Supply Chain and Logistics, Entrepreneurship, Finance, Human Resource Management, Marketing, and Business Technology.  Learning methods involve lectures, seminars, tutorials, individual and group assignments, work-based projects, and presentations.  A significant element is the final-year Business Consultancy Project, where students apply their skills to solve a real-world business problem.  Optional placement year or internships also provide valuable work experience. Throughout the program, students are supported by a Personal Academic Tutor (PAT) who assists with academic and personal development.
Year 1: The first year lays the foundation for business management studies. Students gain a broad understanding of core business principles, encompassing introductory modules covering business functions and general management concepts. This foundational year prepares students for specializing in their chosen pathway in subsequent years. Students will learn about organizational structures, operations, and the broader business environment, enhancing their analytical and problem-solving abilities. They'll engage in group work and individual assignments to develop collaborative and independent skills vital for future roles.
Year 2: Year two builds upon the foundational knowledge gained in year one. Students begin to specialize in their chosen pathway from the provided range of specializations but will still receive modules across core Business concepts. This year involves in-depth study of the chosen specialism, including advanced techniques, skills, and strategic thinking relevant to their pathway. This combines theoretical knowledge with practical engagement through projects, case studies, and potentially early work-related opportunities. Through this structured and increasingly niche learning experience, students deepen their expertise and develop capabilities that will be of use in the workplace.
Year 3: The third year is focused on delivering in-depth specialism based modules which will aid students in their degree in relation to their chosen field. Students will also undergo a significant final year consultancy project – this will be a key aspect that provides the student with in-depth experience in their chosen field and will serve as an asset on their CV’s. The consultancy project allows them to integrate their theoretical knowledge and practical skills, working on a real business challenge. Students who choose to undertake the optional placement year will apply their learnings in an industry environment.

GCSE Maths and English are preferred but not mandatory. For 2025 entry, requirements remain largely unchanged. Contextual offers may be applied for students who are care experienced, estranged from family, refugees, asylum seekers or have parents in the UK armed forces.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or IB from International schools in Pakistan, entry to the first year is possible.

Overview: The University of Derby's Business Management with Foundation Year BA (Hons) is a four-year undergraduate program designed to equip students with both theoretical knowledge and practical skills in business management. The program integrates real-world applications through case studies, simulations, consultancy projects, and work placements.  It covers topical areas such as responsible management, business ethics, business analytics, digital media, and innovation and globalization. Students benefit from CMI accreditation, gaining a professional qualification alongside their degree, access to mentoring and member benefits.  The program incorporates a foundation year to strengthen skills and confidence before progressing to the main degree.  Global perspectives are integrated through collaborations with international partner universities. The updated curriculum addresses growth areas and hot topics in the business world, preparing graduates for a rapidly changing global business environment.
Course Structure: The course structure includes a foundation year followed by three years of the BA (Hons) Business Management degree. The foundation year focuses on strengthening foundational skills and knowledge in business-related subjects.  The subsequent three years cover a range of modules that provide in-depth knowledge and practical experience in core business areas.  The program may involve formal lectures with guest speakers, seminars, tutorials, work experience, consultancy projects, and optional placements or internships. A significant component  involves a business consultancy project providing real-world experience solving business problems.  The opportunity to participate in field trips is also included.
Year 1: The foundation year focuses on developing essential academic and professional skills needed for business-related studies. It acts as a pathway toward the subsequent degree years  and strengthens skills in areas like communication, research and numeracy while also providing an introduction to a spectrum of business topics.
Year 2: The second year of the program builds upon the foundation year, delving deeper into core business subjects such as organizational behavior, marketing principles, financial accounting. Students begin developing more advanced analytical and problem-solving capabilities through assignments and group activities.
Year 3: Year three typically involves more specialized modules selected according to the student's path, either focusing on the general degree or one of the specialized options (Entrepreneurship, Finance, HRM, Marketing, Supply Chain).  Students start to hone expertise in chosen fields, and may undertake the business consultancy project, which includes collaborative work on real projects.
Year 4: The final year may include modules in strategic management, international business, or specialized modules aligned with chosen specializations. The Business Consultancy Project is expected to be a significant part of the year. Students apply project management skills and research methodologies to solve real business problems; this also serves as a valuable addition to their portfolio.

Course Title: Undergraduate Business Management BA (Hons) with Placement Year
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)

Overview: The University of Derby's Business Management BA (Hons) with Placement Year is a four-year undergraduate program designed to equip students with practical business and management skills.  The curriculum includes a placement year, allowing students to gain real-world experience in the field.  The program focuses on developing critical thinking, problem-solving, teamwork, and self-learning abilities, essential for success in a global business environment.  In addition to the degree, students also gain a Chartered Management Institute (CMI) professional qualification.  The program incorporates a variety of learning methods—lectures, seminars, tutorials, projects, and consultancy work—and involves collaboration with international students.
Course Structure: The course is  structured to provide a comprehensive education in business management. It integrates theoretical knowledge with practical experience through assignments simulating workplace tasks like business reports, research projects, presentations, and digital material design. A key component is the final-year Business Consultancy Project, where students apply their learned skills to solve real-world business problems.  The curriculum also includes optional placements or internships, allowing students to apply their learning in professional settings, enhancing employability. The program features personal academic tutoring, to support individual student progress and goal attainment.  Modules will vary, and students are encouraged to check current course details prior to applying.
Year 1: The first year will lay the foundation for understanding core business principles. This may include introductory modules in management, organizational behaviour, economics, accounting and finance, and business communications. Students will start developing essential skills such as critical analysis and problem-solving.  This year helps to ascertain which specialism the student will choose in subsequent years. There may also be an introduction to project management and research methodologies, preparing them for larger projects in later years.
Year 2: Building on the foundational knowledge of year one, year two will involve more specialized modules. This may include subjects such as marketing management, strategic management, operations management, human resource management, and potentially elective modules depending the selected specialism. Students will undertake more complex assessments, including group projects that foster teamwork and collaboration skills.
Year 3: Year three is typically the placement year, where students engage in a full-time work placement in their area of interest. It serves as both work experience and a chance to apply academic knowledge in a real-world, professional scenario. While this year is primarily hands-on, regular check ins and support are provided by University staff to keep the students on track.
Year 4: The final year focuses on advanced business concepts and culminates in the Business Consultancy Project.  Students will integrate the skills and knowledge they've acquired to solve a real-business problem for a client. Modules may include strategic leadership, international business, digital business and other advanced specialism specific topics. The year also involves more in depth discussions on managing global issues in the business world. The final year assessments heavily emphasis the ability to practically apply the knowledge learnt over the duration of the course.

Required IELTS Score: Overall: 6.5, minimum 5.5 in each test category
Entry Requirement: Applicants typically need an undergraduate degree or equivalent.  All applicants are interviewed to assess their understanding of the career guidance profession. A DBS check (or equivalent Certificate of Good Conduct) is mandatory due to placement requirements.  Those lacking traditional qualifications are assessed based on academic achievement, professional experience, and personal qualities.  For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university is required, equivalent to at least a UK Upper Second Class (2:1) or Lower Second Class (2:2).  Students with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees need a Master's degree pass. A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors (minimum GPA 2.4/4.00) from a recognized Pakistani University is also acceptable.
Overview: The MA Career Guidance and Development is a postgraduate program designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge needed for a successful career in career guidance.  It combines a Master's degree with a nationally recognized professional qualification, the Qualification in Career Development (QCD) from the Career Development Institute (CDI).  The program blends theoretical learning with practical experience, including mandatory work-based placements. Students will develop expertise in various career support approaches, utilize career marketing information, learn to harness technology for interventions, and conduct research projects aligned with their interests. The course is designed to be flexible, offering full-time and part-time study options with a variety of teaching methods, including online and in-person sessions.
Course Structure: The curriculum integrates theoretical perspectives on career development with practical applications. Core modules cover personal career guidance and coaching, designing and managing career education programs, understanding the career guidance professional, and navigating career guidance policy and contemporary society.  Students learn to effectively use career and labor market information in practice and undertake an independent study project. This program also includes a mandatory professional qualification, the QCD from the CDI and a portfolio showcasing the development of professional skills is also required.  The program incorporates blended learning, with online modules and in-person lectures and workshops.
Year 1: The full-time program covers all modules within one year. These modules often include modules on theoretical perspectives on career development; designing, delivering and managing programs in careers education; the career guidance professional, career guidance policy and contemporary society; and using career and labour market information in career guidance practice. Students also undertake independent study which results in a dissertation.
Year 2: Part-time students complete the program over two years, spreading the modules across both years. Independent study and dissertation are usually completed in the second year for part-time students.

Course Title: Certificate in Education Post 14 Further Education and Skills
Entry Requirement: For UK students applying part-time, with prior qualifications, or for entry into Year 2 or 3, direct application to the University is required.  For Pakistani students seeking undergraduate admission and completing A-levels or the International Baccalaureate from Pakistani international schools, entry into Year 1 is possible.  Postgraduate applicants from Pakistan must hold a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university, equivalent to at least a UK Upper Second Class (2:1) or Lower Second Class (2:2) degree. Those with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees will also need a Master's degree. A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors (minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00) from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable for Masters entry. PhD applicants from Pakistan need a Master’s and Bachelor’s degree in a relevant area and must submit a research proposal.
Overview: The Certificate in Education Post 14 Further Education and Skills is a two-year, part-time program designed for individuals teaching post-14 learners in various settings, including FE colleges, training establishments, special schools, academies, prisons and young offender institutions. This course is also suitable for teaching assistants who are trainers.  The program offers a strong foundation for professional development through practical teaching opportunities, theoretical study and discourse.  It combines coursework, teaching practice observations, self-evaluation, reflective tasks, assignments, presentations, and group work, requiring at least 50 hours of teaching delivery.  The course emphasizes applying theory to practice and using appropriate academic writing.  Upon completion, the 120-credit Level 5/6 qualification enables teaching in the FE and skills sector.  Graduates can potentially top up their qualification to a BA (Hons) Education.
Course Structure: The course structure blends practical teaching experiences with theoretical studies. Students undertake coursework, observe teaching practices, engage in self-evaluation and reflective tasks, and complete assignments, presentations, and group work.  A significant component includes delivering a minimum of 50 hours of teaching.  The curriculum emphasizes applying theoretical knowledge to practical teaching situations and uses the Harvard referencing system.  Learning theory is integrated into all assessments. The exact modules are subject to change, reflecting regular course reviews to enhance quality and graduate prospects. While specific modules are not detailed, the overall focus is on providing a strong pedagogical foundation for teaching post-14 learners.

Course Title: Certificate of Credit in Clay Drying and Firing
Entry Requirement: Entry requirements include employment or affiliation with an employer, nomination by a line manager or recruitment manager, organizational identification of the learner's potential for success, adherence to the University's equal opportunities policies, demonstration of English language proficiency equivalent to GCSE English Language or IELTS 6.0, completion of a University of Derby application form, and being 18 years or older upon program commencement.  Prior experience is a key factor; employers, learners, professional bodies, and stakeholders were consulted during program development.  For Pakistani students, specific requirements are not listed on the provided webpage, however general university requirements for undergraduate degrees in Pakistan would apply.
Overview: The Certificate of Credit in Clay Drying and Firing is a part-time, one-year program designed for individuals working in clay drying and firing applications, or related supply and equipment manufacturing industries.  The course aims to provide learners with a strong foundation in the scientific and practical aspects of clay drying and firing, equipping them with the knowledge and skills to enhance their services and better serve their clients. The course offers flexible learning opportunities, utilizing online materials and face-to-face sessions, ideal for those in remote or geographically dispersed work settings.
Course Structure: The program consists of one module: Clay Drying and Firing. This module covers practical and scientific knowledge of clay drying and firing techniques, including methods for preparation and drying of clay products, firing techniques, kilns, chemistry and economics of firing, statistical process control, and safe operation within pollution control regulations.  The module also explores product standards, quality management processes, and environmental considerations, enhancing understanding of customer requirements and product conformity.
Year 1: The single module focuses on the practical and scientific aspects of clay drying and firing.  Students will learn various methods for preparing and drying clay products, understand the chemistry and economics of different firing techniques, learn about safe operation and pollution control, and gain knowledge of quality management systems and environmental considerations. The module incorporates practical projects focused on the workplace, technical report writing, presentations, and problem-solving tasks to enhance learning.

Overview: This Certificate of Credit in Construction Materials Technology is a flexible, part-time program designed for working professionals in the construction materials industry.  The curriculum emphasizes practical application of knowledge gained, using a blended learning model combining online resources and face-to-face sessions at a corporate environment. The program equips learners with a better understanding of construction materials, global and environmental influences on the sector, and enhances critical and reflective practices, making them better-suited for roles in testing laboratories, materials manufacturing, or related industries.  The program helps address shortfalls in national and international development needs, and it aids professional growth and independent learning.
Course Structure: The program focuses on the Construction Materials Technology module, which covers aggregates, the creation of construction materials using aggregates, relevant standards, mixture design, the production and use of bituminous mixtures and ready-mixed concrete, and product quality management.  Instruction utilizes a mixture of face-to-face sessions, online learning, action learning sets, workplace-based learning opportunities, individual reflection, and a sophisticated virtual learning environment (VLE). It explores standards, specifications, and testing methods for aggregates, bituminous mixtures, and ready-mixed concrete.  Students will gain proficiency in mixture design, the production and application of these materials and managing the quality of these products to fulfill the requirements of clients and producers. The program incorporates different learning methodologies to help students adapt this knowledge in their working environments.

Employers typically set their own entry criteria, but a Level 3 qualification (like A-levels at grades A-C or equivalent) is usually expected, along with Level 2 qualifications in Maths, English, and ICT (e.g., GCSEs).  Due to the top-up nature, an informal interview and skills scan with the employer will assess the candidate's existing knowledge, skills, and behavior. It provides a quicker route to a BA (Hons) in Business Management and Leadership and Chartered Manager status (CMgr) by bypassing levels 4 and 5 modules. The program focuses on practical capability and competence within management, tailoring content to specific industries where demand exists.  A significant portion (80%) involves on-the-job learning and work-related tasks.  Personal and professional development is emphasized, covering key learning approaches, behavior, reflection, and critical issues such as professional ethics, decision-making, and sustainability.  The program promotes responsible management education, aiming to develop future generators of sustainable value for business and society.

Modules typically include Innovative Operations Management, Strategic Leadership, Emerging Digital Trends and Issues, Business Impact Project, and Professional Review. Successful completion leads to a BA (Hons) degree and Chartered Manager status.

The Business Impact Project likely involves a significant real-world project within the employer’s business, implementing strategic changes. Course Title: Level 4 Children, Young People and Families Practitioner Apprenticeship
Required IELTS Score: NA
Entry Requirement: The apprenticeship requires current employment of at least 30 hours per week.  A DBS check (Disclosure and Barring Service) is also mandatory to work with children.  For apprentices lacking level 2 English and Maths qualifications, achieving this level is necessary before the endpoint assessment.  Regarding Pakistani students, the provided text does not specify any additional entry requirements beyond meeting the general employment and DBS check requirements.  However, it is noteworthy that this is an apprenticeship program rather than a traditional degree path.  Applicants must maintain employment throughout the programme.
Overview: The Level 4 Children, Young People and Families Practitioner Apprenticeship is a two-year program combining on-the-job training with university-led sessions.  The apprenticeship focuses on developing skills to assess and address the complex needs of children, young people, and their families within community settings like schools, nurseries, or youth centers.  Students learn to make effective interventions, referrals, and collaborate with other professionals to improve outcomes for the individuals they serve. Emphasis is placed on evidence-based practices, regular evaluation, and reflective practice through supervision. The program is designed to develop students into effective, autonomous, and reflective practitioners.
Course Structure: The apprenticeship integrates on-the-job training (80%) with university-led learning (20%).  University sessions involve two full days per month, typically on Tuesdays, encompassing various modules.  Students also dedicate equivalent time each month to portfolio development, reflection exercises, observation tasks, and evaluating interventions.  The curriculum is aligned to Apprenticeship Standards, with assessments built to demonstrate competency.  The university provides access to physical and online resources.  Continuing Professional Development is also mandatory, covering areas such as safeguarding and work-based processes.
Year 1: The first year of the apprenticeship introduces fundamental concepts in child and family welfare.  Students gain practical experience in direct work with children and families.  Modules may cover assessment techniques, intervention strategies, and effective communication skills. Building a strong foundation in safeguarding and legal frameworks governing child protection is crucial.   Students develop skills in working collaboratively with others to support the well-being of children and their families.
Year 2: The second year builds upon the foundation established in Year 1. Students deepen their understanding of complex family dynamics, including factors influencing child development and risk assessment. Advanced intervention methods and case management skills are developed.  Students hone professional judgement, refining their ability to match evidence-based approaches to individual needs.  Greater emphasis is placed on professional reflection and self-evaluation of practice, in line with the goals of becoming a skilled, autonomous professional able to contribute meaningfully to the field.

The program blends theoretical study with practical experiences,  preparing graduates for roles as confident, knowledgeable, and successful practitioners in the area of child and youth services.

Course Title: BSc (Hons) Child and Family Health and Wellbeing
Required IELTS Score: 6.5 (with at least 6.0 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 104 UCAS points, A-Levels BCC, T Level Merit, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or a Pass Access to HE Diploma.  An Enhanced Disclosure & Barring Service certificate is needed.  Contextual offers may apply to students from specific backgrounds (care experienced, estranged families, refugees, asylum seekers, or those with parents in the UK armed forces).  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or IB from international schools in Pakistan, direct entry into Year 1 is possible. For postgraduate study, a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class Honours degree is required; those with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees need a Master's pass. A four-year Bachelor's degree with a minimum 2.4/4.0 GPA from a recognized Pakistani university is also considered for Master's entry.
Annual Tuition Fee: UK: £9,535 per year; International: £16,900 per year
Overview: The BSc (Hons) Child and Family Health and Wellbeing degree at the University of Derby prepares students for careers supporting children and families.  The program focuses on practical application, equipping students with skills and knowledge to address issues like health inequalities and poverty.  Students will develop skills through projects, a work placement, and research, learning to provide high-quality support in various settings, including family support and community health. The course emphasizes a holistic view of children's needs and prepares graduates for roles in family support, community health, and other related fields.  The program also integrates professional partnerships, ensuring up-to-date and relevant learning through guest speakers and collaboration with employers in the health and social care sector.  Many forms of assessment are used; there are no exams.
Course Structure: The course is highly practical and vocational, using a combination of lectures, tutorials, seminars, workshops, group work, presentations, independent research, and placements. Assessments are work-related, focusing on professional practice and include reflective diaries, practical work in skills suites, presentations, reports, portfolios, and observations.  The curriculum covers a broad range of topics related to child and family well-being, including health psychology, research methods,  practical projects (healthy eating, exercise, dental health), and interprofessional learning with students from other disciplines. A major research project in the final year allows students to focus on a chosen theme within a workplace setting.
Year 1: The first year will likely introduce fundamental concepts in child and family health and wellbeing, exploring relevant theories and frameworks. Students are introduced to research methods needed for their  later studies. A foundational understanding of relevant legislation, policy, and ethical considerations will be provided. Students may also undertake activities to build foundational support skills.
Year 2: The second year builds upon the foundational knowledge from year one. Modules will probably cover more advanced theories and practices in areas such as child development, family dynamics, and health promotion.  Students will develop their practical research methods skills. Students will likely engage in group work, individual projects, and presentations.
Year 3: The final year includes a substantial work placement, allowing students to apply their knowledge and skills in a real-world setting. Students will complete a major research project, culminating in a dissertation.  Advanced topics in child protection and family support are introduced, alongside developing professional communication and collaboration skills.  This year will integrate interprofessional learning experiences.

Overview: The University of Derby offers a four-year BSc (Hons) in Child and Family Health and Wellbeing, including a foundation year. This program is designed to prepare students for careers supporting children and families, addressing health inequalities and poverty. The course emphasizes practical skills development in health and social care settings, combining theoretical knowledge with real-world experience. Students will benefit from a supportive learning environment, experienced teaching staff, and access to excellent facilities.  The program is suitable for those seeking a career change or those who need a more gradual introduction to higher education.
Course Structure: The course structure includes a foundation year followed by three years of the BSc (Hons) program. The foundation year provides a solid base in health and social care, building foundational skills and knowledge before progressing to the main degree. The three subsequent years cover core aspects of child and family health and wellbeing. The curriculum will include modules relevant to child development, family dynamics, health inequalities, social issues, and practical application. Students will engage in various learning activities, potentially including workshops, case studies, group projects, and placements. There will be opportunities to interact with real-world settings, integrating theory with practical experiences.
Year 1: The foundation year focuses on developing essential academic literacy and study skills for university study.  It provides an introduction to core concepts in health and social care, child development, and the social issues affecting families.  Students build a foundational knowledge base and confidence to move to further education.  The year might include modules on health and social care systems, communication skills, and basic research methods.
Year 2: Year two builds upon the foundation year by introducing students to more specialized modules. It could include more in-depth study of child development theories, health promotion techniques, family support strategies, and working with vulnerable families.  Students begin to specialize in this field and apply knowledge to relevant case studies and practical exercises.
Year 3: The third year includes more advanced coursework, building on knowledge from previous years.  Subjects may cover areas such as advanced social work practices, mental health issues in children and families, social policy, and relevant legislation concerning child protection.  Students gain experience through further projects and additional placements outside of the campus.
Year 4: In the final year, students will complete a more advanced study and potentially a research project. They might specialize in certain areas within child and family health and wellbeing, applying their skills to more complex scenarios. The final year will strengthen the skills necessary to work in the field, including analysis, critical thinking, and problem-solving.

Overview: This 12-week Level 6 and 7 Child Development course offered by the University of Derby is designed for healthcare professionals such as Health Visitors, School Nurses, Paediatric Nurses, and Social Workers.  It focuses on the development of children across all ages while emphasizing vulnerabilities within this population.  The course explores child development theories, attachment, and resilience, along with assessment tools and care models, critically evaluating their effectiveness.  Participants engage in lectures, group work, activities, and case studies, promoting proactive practices and safeguarding within multi-agency environments. Successful completion of this course enhances participants’ knowledge and skills in child development, legislative understanding, and multi-agency collaboration.
Course Structure: The course structure consists of lectures, group work sessions, hands-on activities, and case study analyses.  The curriculum covers child development theories, attachment and resilience concepts, and the critical appraisal of assessment tools and care models.  Significant emphasis is placed on legislative impact, national policies, and their consequences within multi-agency service delivery.  The course emphasizes critical discussions around proactive child welfare practices and safeguarding concerns within diverse professional settings.  Student participation and engagement are integral to the learning experience. The combination of theoretical knowledge and practical applications helps to prepare graduates for effective interventions in varied contexts.

Course Title: MSc Civil Engineering and Construction Management
Entry Requirement: A minimum of a 2:2 undergraduate degree in civil engineering or construction management is required.  Consideration will be given to equivalent professional qualifications and relevant experience.  For non-native English speakers, an IELTS score of 6.0 or equivalent is necessary.  For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university is needed, equivalent to at least a UK Lower Second Class (2:2) degree.  A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors and a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable. Students with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees must also have a Master's degree.
Annual Tuition Fee: £9,720 for the full course or £1,055 per 20 credits (Full-time); £1,055 per 20 credits (Part-time) for UK Students; £16,900 for the full course (Full-time), N/A (Part-time) for International Students
Overview: The MSc Civil Engineering and Construction Management program at the University of Derby combines theoretical knowledge with practical skills in strategic management.  It prepares graduates for global careers and boosts professional credibility through accreditation by several engineering and construction bodies, including the Institution of Civil Engineers and the Chartered Institute of Building. The curriculum covers critical industry issues like flood risk management and sustainable development, applying learning to real-world projects.  The program develops crucial transferable skills such as research, critical thinking, and communication, enhancing employability in civil engineering and construction management fields.  Students benefit from a stimulating learning environment, with real-life project alignment and site visits. The program also meets the Further Learning requirements for Chartered Engineer (CEng) status but requires an already accredited undergraduate degree.
Course Structure: The course is structured in three stages: Postgraduate Certificate, Postgraduate Diploma, and MSc.  Each stage involves core and optional modules.  Core modules include Environmental Risk and Responsibility, Continuing Professional Development and Strategic Management, and Project Planning, Value Engineering, and Risk Management.  Optional modules offer a range of specializations such as Transport and Infrastructure Engineering and Sustainable Design, BIM and Integrated Project Collaboration, Sustainable Construction Methods and Materials, and Geomatic Monitoring and Asset Engineering.  The MSc stage also includes an Independent Scholarship module focused on research methodology and a postgraduate research project.
Year 1: Year 1 (Full-time) covers the Postgraduate Certificate modules: Environmental Risk and Responsibility, introducing students to the interaction of professional actions with environmental impacts and sustainable solutions. Two optional modules from the list above enable specialization.  Students develop core competencies in risk assessments, mitigation strategies, design standards, and sustainable project delivery.   The course includes an introduction to BIM, and project collaboration principles. Continuing professional development topics introduces concepts of strategic management and business ethics.
Year 2: Year 2 (Full-time) encompasses the Postgraduate Diploma modules. Continuing Professional Development builds on the foundation laid in the first year, focusing on practical application and refinement of managerial skills in global contexts. Project Planning, Value Engineering, and Risk Management are also covered in depth. Students also elect two optional modules from the selection in the course outline. This allows for further specialisation within the field of Civil Engineering and Construction.

Course Title: MSc Civil Engineering and Construction Management
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (minimum of 5.5 in any areas)
Entry Requirement: Applicants need at least a 2.2 degree or equivalent in a Civil Engineering or Construction-related discipline.  Those without a degree or an accredited one may be considered with significant relevant industrial experience, evidenced in their application.  The University follows recognition of prior learning (RPL) guidelines, recommending it only with an appropriate portfolio of professional work.  The Negotiated module (7ME506) is exempt from RPL, and RPL is unavailable for the Independent Scholarship 60-credit module. For Pakistan, students must have a relevant Bachelor’s degree from a recognized University, equivalent to at least a UK ‘Upper Second Class (2:1)’ or ‘Lower Second Class (2:2)’ degree. Those with a two or three-year Bachelor's degree also need a Master’s degree pass. A Bachelor's degree with honors (four-year) with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani University is considered for entry.
Overview: The online MSc in Civil Engineering and Construction Management provides a comprehensive education combining in-depth knowledge, practical skills, and strategic management abilities.  The program is designed to address current and future industry challenges, such as flood risk management and sustainable development.   It develops technical expertise alongside transferable skills like research, critical thinking, and communication. The curriculum includes a blend of core and optional modules, allowing students to tailor their studies to specific interests within civil engineering and construction management.  Many academics are Chartered Engineers with industry links, enriching students' learning and career prospects. The program also helps students progress toward Chartered Engineer status.
Course Structure: The program consists of two core 20-credit modules, one prescribed 20-credit module, three optional 20-credit modules, and a 60-credit Independent Scholarship, totaling 180 credits.  Modules cover highly relevant topics including flood risk engineering management, sustainable development, environmental performance management, project planning, value engineering, risk management, transport and infrastructure engineering, and sustainable design.  Optional modules might include Geomatic Monitoring and Asset Engineering, and Advanced Geotechnical Engineering which include a three-day (or five-day) field residential depending on modules selected.  The program also incorporates personal development planning (PDP) focused on employability.
