An Access to HE Diploma with 60 credits (45 at Level 3) is also acceptable.  Contextual offers may be available for students from disadvantaged backgrounds (care experienced, estranged from family, refugees, asylum seekers, or those with parents/carers in the UK armed forces).  Students from Pakistan studying A-levels or the IB from International Schools can enter directly into Year 1. Postgraduate entry requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2.  A Master's degree is required for students with a two or three-year Bachelor's degree; however, a four-year Bachelor's degree with honours and a minimum 2.4/4.00 GPA is also considered.  PhD entry requires a Master's and Bachelor's degree in a relevant subject area, along with a research proposal.
Overview: The BSc (Hons) Information Technology degree at the University of Derby is designed to equip students with the skills needed for a successful career in the ever-evolving field of information technology. The program focuses on two key themes: data analysis and big data, and the management of computer systems in business. Students will learn to use leading analytical tools such as R, Python, and Tableau while tackling real-world business problems through case studies and projects.  The curriculum integrates theoretical knowledge with practical experience, providing a well-rounded education for graduates seeking diverse opportunities in the IT industry. The program is known for its flexible structure allowing students to potential transfer to other Computing degrees after the first year, and its focus on coursework assessment instead of exams.
Course Structure: The course is made up of a variety of modules covering data analysis, big data, management of computer systems in business and other related computing and business topics. The first year provides foundational knowledge shared with other computing degrees, with specialization beginning in the second year.  The final year allows for further specialization according to areas of student interest.  Students benefit from optional placement year, allowing them to integrate their learning in professional setting. Assessment methods are varied, and include computer-based tests, short research papers, presentations, and portfolios, eliminating the need for written exams.
Year 1: The first year provides a foundation in core computing principles and concepts shared with other computing degrees.  Students gain fundamental knowledge across a broad range of technology-related areas. This year serves as an introduction to the field, allowing students to explore different aspects before choosing to specialise or transfer to other degree programs within the computing department.
Year 2: The second year introduces specialized modules directly related to Information Technology. Students will delve deeper into data analysis techniques, explore advanced concepts in business systems management,  and strengthen their practical skills in using analytical software. Case studies and projects will become more focused on applying knowledge to industry-relevant challenges.
Year 3: In the third year, students further specialize, tailoring their studies to their areas of interest. This might involve modules focused on specific data analysis techniques, advanced database management, cybersecurity aspects, or other relevant areas.  The final year project allows for in-depth study and demonstration of advanced skills in a chosen area.
Year 4: The optional fourth year provides a placement opportunity in a real-world business setting. Students apply their knowledge, gain valuable experience, and develop professional skills, strengthening the skills and experience they can put on their resume. It's considered by many students to be the most rewarding aspect of the entire program.

Entry Requirement: Applicants need an honors degree (at least a 2.2) or equivalent qualifications/experience in a computing discipline.  If English isn't your first language, you'll need to show English proficiency (IELTS 6.0 or equivalent). For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university is required, equivalent to at least a UK 'Upper Second Class (2:1)' or 'Lower Second Class (2:2)' degree. Those with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees need a Master's degree pass. A Bachelor's degree with honors (four-year BA, BBA, BSc, BEng) with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable for Masters entry.
Overview: The University of Derby's MSc Information Technology program provides a strong foundation in both theoretical knowledge and practical skills in information technology.  The curriculum focuses on using IT to solve real-world business challenges, covering emerging technologies like cloud computing and data mining. Students will develop skills in project management, database development, web technologies, and business analytics. The program is designed to be flexible, offering full-time and part-time options, and culminating in a dissertation where students tackle a commercial IT problem.  The program is taught by research-active academics and industry experts, drawing on expertise from the Data Science Research Centre (DSRC).
Course Structure: The MSc Information Technology is structured in three stages: Postgraduate Certificate (three modules from a list including Studying at Masters Level and Research Methods, Database Development, IT Project Management, Object Oriented Analysis, Design and Implementation, Business Analytics with SAS, and Web Technologies), Postgraduate Diploma (all six modules from the Postgraduate Certificate), and MSc (all six modules plus a triple module, Independent Scholarship, which involves formulating and resolving a commercial IT problem, often with industry collaboration).  The specific modules and their sequencing may vary depending on the start date.
Year 1: The first year of the full-time MSc Information Technology program covers the Postgraduate Certificate modules and some of the Postgraduate Diploma modules, depending on the chosen start date. Students will develop their research skills, learn about database technologies and project management, and gain hands-on experience in programming paradigms, business analytics (using SAS), and web technologies. The teaching methodology involves lectures, seminars, practical sessions, and presentations.
Year 2: NA

Course Title: Undergraduate Information Technology with Foundation Year BSc (Hons)
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 72 UCAS points, A Levels (DDD), T Level (Pass), BTEC (MMP), GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or an Access to HE Diploma.  International students need an IELTS score of 6.0 with at least 5.5 in each skill.  For Pakistani students completing A-Levels or IB from International Schools in Pakistan, direct entry into the first year is possible.  Contextual offers may be available for students meeting specific criteria such as being care experienced, estranged from families, refugees, asylum seekers, or having parents/carers in the UK armed forces.  Students must declare these criteria on their application.
Annual Tuition Fee: UK: £9,250 per year; International: £16,900 per year
Overview: The BSc (Hons) Information Technology with Foundation Year is a four-year undergraduate program designed in conjunction with industry.  It focuses on data analysis, big data, and the management of computer systems in business. Students will learn to use modern analysis tools like R, Python, and Tableau. The course includes a potential placement year, providing valuable work experience.  The foundation year strengthens skills and knowledge before progressing to the honors degree.  Graduates will be prepared for careers in various sectors leveraging their expertise in data analysis and IT management.
Course Structure: The program consists of a foundation year followed by three years of specialized study. The curriculum covers data analysis and the use of big data, the management of computer systems in business, and related computing and business topics.  Students utilize leading analysis tools.  The curriculum structure for later years is flexible allowing for optional transfer to other Computing courses. There are no written exams; assessment is through coursework, including short exercises, research papers, computer-based tests, presentations, and portfolios of IT projects. A dissertation is part of the final year.
Year 1: The first year is the foundation year, designed to build a strong base in computing and related subjects. Students acquire fundamental knowledge alongside students in other Computing and Mathematics degrees. This year helps students develop analytical, technical and practical skills in preparation for the main degree program.
Year 2: Year two begins the main BSc (Hons) Information Technology program. Students focus on specialist modules for this degree, building upon the foundation year's knowledge.  This year introduces students to more advanced programming tools, databases and systems.
Year 3: The third year incorporates more advanced topics in data analysis, business intelligence, and the management of computer systems.  Students may also complete an optional placement year which improves graduate prospects significantly. This placement provides hands-on experience in a professional setting, relating learned skills to real-world situations and allowing students to build networks with industry professionals.
Year 4: The final year involves further specialized modules, allowing students to tailor their studies according to their interests. This year includes an independent studies project, often involving a significant research component and the writing of a dissertation. Students present and defend their final project.

Course Title: Certificate of Credit in Innovating Learning, Teaching and Assessment Toward Enhanced Professional Practice
Required IELTS Score: 7.0 (6.5 in Writing with 7.0 in other sections)
Entry Requirement: Applicants typically need a health or social care-related degree, a teaching role within the health or social care sector, employer support with protected study time, and a qualified mentor.  Evidence of level 6 study (minimum 20 credits) and at least 6-12 months relevant experience may also be considered.  For Pakistan, a relevant Bachelor's degree (equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2) from a recognised university is needed. If the Bachelor's is 2 or 3 years long, a Master's pass is mandated.  A 4-year Bachelor's with Honours (minimum GPA 2.4/4.00) may suffice for Master's entry.  English language proficiency is required for non-native speakers.  Specific IELTS, TOEFL, or equivalent scores are detailed on the University website.
Overview: This postgraduate certificate of credit focuses on innovating learning, teaching, and assessment within health, social care, and allied health professions.  The course enhances professional practice by providing participants with the skills to design and deliver engaging higher education programs for diverse learners.  It emphasizes education for sustainable development and inclusive practices, incorporating modern assessment methods to improve learning outcomes.  The curriculum blends online study with practical application through workplace learning, requiring participants to actively engage in teaching and associated activities under the guidance of a mentor.
Course Structure: The course consists of a single core module (20 credits) at level 7. This module covers theories and principles of teaching, learning, and assessment, alongside self-reflection and the development of critical reflection techniques in the role of a practice educator.  The curriculum addresses assessment methods and their crucial role in protecting service users.  Work-based learning is integrated, mandating 20 hours of teaching and 40 hours of associated activity under the supervision of a Practice Education Facilitator (PEF). Upon successful completion, students meet the requirements of Advance HE Professional Standards Framework Descriptor 1 (D1).
Year 1: NA
Year 2: NA

Required IELTS Score: NA
Entry Requirement: No formal qualifications are required for this course.  The course description specifically states that no formal qualifications are needed to participate.  Regarding Pakistan-specific entry requirements, the University of Derby's website does not offer explicit details for this particular short course. The general entry requirements for postgraduate programs at the University of Derby are applicable if this course is considered as part of further postgraduate study; this would require a relevant bachelor's degree from a recognised university equivalent to at least a UK ‘Upper Second Class (2:1)’ or ‘Lower Second Class (2:2)’ degree. Students with a two or three-year Bachelor's degree would need a passing grade in a Master's degree. A Bachelor's degree with honors (four-year BA, BBA, BSc, BEng) and a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognised Pakistani university may also be considered for entry to a master's program, depending on how this is classified at Derby university.
Overview: The Institute of Acoustics Certificate of Competence in Environmental Noise Measurement is a 5-day, 35-hour intensive course designed to provide practical skills and theoretical knowledge in environmental noise measurement.  It's aimed at professionals working in local authorities, environmental consultancies, or other organizations dealing with environmental noise. The course covers fundamental concepts of sound, noise indices, and units; instrumentation for noise measurement, including calibration; various noise assessment methods and standards; practical field measurement techniques emphasizing good practice and potential limitations. It also explores noise propagation from different sources and the influence of the environment. The course concludes with a practical and a written exam, leading to a certificate accredited by the Institute of Acoustics and potentially enhancing career prospects.
Course Structure: The course is structured across five key areas: 1. Basic Concepts of Environmental Noise: This section introduces fundamental concepts, definitions, and calculations involving sound, noise indices, units, and decibels. 2. Instrumentation for Environmental Noise Measurement:  This module focuses on the characteristics and properties of integrating sound level meters and the importance of calibration. 3. Noise Indices and Measurement Methodologies: This section explores various noise assessment methods and standards, including guidelines for planning applications, BS4142, CRTN, and BS5228, with a strong emphasis on measurement methodologies. 4. Environmental Noise Measurement in Practice: This involves hands-on field practice, focusing on the principles and good practices of noise measurement while exploring the limitations through case studies, including the implementation of BS7445. 5. Overview of Noise Propagation: This final section delves into the propagation of noise from various sound sources and the environmental factors affecting it.  The course includes both practical sessions and a written assessment, with the practical exam conducted on the last day and a written exam usually two weeks later.
Year 1: NA
Year 2: NA

Required IELTS Score: NA
Entry Requirement: No formal qualifications are required for this course.  The provided text focuses on the course details and does not contain entry requirements information for international students in general, nor specific requirements for Pakistani students.  Successful completion leads to technical membership of the Institute of Acoustics.  The information provided does not mention requirements for standardized tests like GCE A Levels, International Baccalaureate, GRE, GMAT, or any other specified tests.
Overview: The Institute of Acoustics Certificate of Competence in Workplace Noise Assessment is a practical, five-day course designed to equip participants with the skills and knowledge necessary to conduct effective workplace noise risk assessments.  The course covers fundamental concepts of noise, measurement techniques, assessment strategies, legal aspects (including the Control of Noise at Work Regulations 2005), and noise reduction methods.  Participants will learn to use sound level meters and dosimeters, calculate personal noise exposure levels, and understand the implications of hearing loss and appropriate protection.  The course is suitable for individuals with health and safety responsibilities or those working in noise consultancy.
Course Structure: The course is structured into six key areas:  Basic Concepts of Noise (definitions, principles, sound indices, units, decibel calculations); Measurement and Instrumentation for Noise Assessment (integrating sound level meter features, calibration, dosimeter properties); Noise Exposure Assessment (measurement strategies, data collection limitations, calculation of personal noise exposure levels, and action planning); Hearing, Hearing Loss Measurement and Protection (ear structure, hearing mechanism, hearing defects, hearing protectors, limitations and advantages); Overview of Legal Aspects (Control of Noise at Work Regulations 2005 and relevant guidance documents); and Noise Reduction Techniques (noise control methods from source to receiver).  The course involves practical exercises and a written and practical exam.
Year 1: NA
Year 2: NA

Course Title: Diploma in Acoustics and Noise Control
Required IELTS Score: NA
Entry Requirement: Applicants need an undergraduate degree, diploma, or higher national diploma in a science or science-related discipline.  Non-standard entry candidates can also apply.  For Pakistani students, those completing A-levels or the International Baccalaureate (IB) from Pakistani international schools can enter the first year of a bachelor's degree. Postgraduate applicants must have completed a relevant bachelor's degree from a recognized Pakistani university, equivalent to at least a UK ‘Upper Second Class (2:1)’ or ‘Lower Second Class (2:2)’ degree.  Those with two or three-year bachelor's degrees need a master's degree pass.  A bachelor's degree with honors (four-year BA, BBA, BSc, BEng) with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani university is also considered for master's entry.
Overview: The Institute of Acoustics Diploma in Acoustics and Noise Control is a part-time, on-campus course designed for professionals seeking to enhance their careers in acoustics.  It provides practical skills and problem-solving abilities essential for professional acousticians.  Students can specialize in areas like building acoustics, environmental noise, and noise control engineering. The program is accredited by the Institute of Acoustics, meeting the educational requirements for membership. While primarily for those already employed, it also benefits recent graduates.  The course incorporates theoretical knowledge with practical laboratory and fieldwork, allowing students to implement their learning and contribute to the field of acoustics. Overall, this course offers a structured pathway for career advancement and professional development in the field of acoustics.
Course Structure: The course covers core modules in General Principles of Acoustics (exploring sound behavior, measurement, and noise indices) and Laboratory and Experimental Methods (developing practical skills). Students then choose two specialist modules from options including Building Acoustics, Regulation and Assessment of Noise, Environmental Noise: Prediction, Measurement and Control, and Noise and Vibration Control Engineering. Finally, students complete an individual research project allowing for specialized studies in an area of personal or professional interest.   The course blends theoretical concepts, practical laboratory work, and individual research to develop expertise in acoustics.
Year 1: The first and only year of the program covers foundational concepts in acoustics, with a focus on the General Principles of Acoustics and laboratory experimental methods. Students will undertake a research project allowing for an in-depth study of a chosen area. They will also develop specialized knowledge by selecting and completing two modules from the options available: Building Acoustics, Regulation and Assessment of Noise, Environmental Noise: Prediction, Measurement and Control, and Noise and Vibration Control Engineering. The blend of core and specialized modules will fully equip students for future work.
Year 2: NA

Course Title: Integrated Urgent Care Workforce Development Programme for Pharmacists
Required IELTS Score: NA
Entry Requirement: Pharmacists must be recruited into an Integrated Urgent Care (IUC) Clinical Assessment Service (CAS) as part of NHS England’s IUC Pharmacists Programme and work a minimum of 0.4WTE (two days or 15 hours a week) in the IUC CAS setting.  Employer confirmation is required for all applications.  For those from Pakistan, specific requirements are not detailed on the provided course page; however, general University of Derby requirements for postgraduate programs specify an IELTS score of 6.5 with a minimum of 5.5 in all areas, or a PTE score of 60.  A relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized Pakistani university, equivalent to at least a UK ‘Upper Second Class (2:1)’ or ‘Lower Second Class (2:2)’ degree, is typically required.  Those with two or three-year Bachelor degrees usually need a Master's degree as well. A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors and a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 might be sufficient.
Overview: The Integrated Urgent Care Workforce Development Programme for Pharmacists is a 12-month, flexible, workplace-based and online course designed to enhance the skills of pharmacists working in virtual contact centers.  The program focuses on improving access, quality, and safety of patient care.  It covers essential topics such as communication, telephone consultations, history-taking, and ethical and legal considerations within the context of minor ailments and common conditions.  Participants will also develop leadership skills within their areas of expertise. The program is fully funded and offered through a blended learning platform including online modules, face-to-face sessions, and online support.
Course Structure: The course comprises three main stages.  It begins with foundational knowledge: communication techniques, telephone consultations, history-taking, pertinent policies and procedures, and ethical and legal aspects.  The second stage expands on the consultation process, focusing on history-taking and symptom analysis for a variety of minor ailments or commonly presented conditions., emphasizing safe and effective decision-making. Finally, learners consolidate their knowledge and grow leadership abilities by focusing on their specializations and disseminating their learning.  The program utilizes a blended learning approach, combining online modules, interactive activities, facilitated discussions, and potentially in-person sessions.  Assessments include portfolio development linked to competency frameworks.
Year 1: NA
Year 2: NA

Required IELTS Score: Overall: 6.5, with at least 6.0 in each skill area
Entry Requirement: Applicants need an undergraduate degree, experience working with people, and excellent communication and listening skills.  An IELTS score of at least 6.5 (with at least 6.0 in each skill area) is required for non-native English speakers. A Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check is necessary upon accepting a place. For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university is needed, equivalent to at least a UK 'Upper Second Class (2:1)' or 'Lower Second Class (2:2)' degree. Those with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees must also have a Master's degree. A Bachelor's degree with honors (four-year BA, BBA, BSc, BEng) with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable for Master's degree entry.
Overview: The MSc Integrative Counselling and Psychotherapy is a BACP-accredited program designed to equip students with the theoretical knowledge and practical skills necessary for a career in integrative counselling and psychotherapy.  The course covers person-centered therapy, attachment theory, and cognitive behavioral psychotherapy, integrating these approaches within a trans-theoretical framework.  Students develop skills in clinical practice through supervised sessions, refining their ability to understand the complexities of human problems and apply relevant therapeutic techniques.  The curriculum emphasizes critical reflection, ethical practice, and research methodologies within a social, cultural, and ideological context of therapeutic work.
Course Structure: The program consists of three stages: Postgraduate Certificate, Postgraduate Diploma, and MSc. The Postgraduate Certificate includes modules on integrating psychotherapeutic theory and practice, professional practice, and current developments in psychotherapeutic theory and practice. The Postgraduate Diploma adds Research Methods, Ethics, and Law in Psychotherapeutic Practice, Professional Integrative Practice, and Professional Practice 2. The MSc culminates in an Independent Scholarship module involving a dissertation.  Each module incorporates varied assessment methods, including written assignments, case studies, reflective journals, portfolios, presentations, and a final dissertation. Clinical practice is a significant part of the course, starting in the second module for part-time students and later for full-time students, with assessments incorporating real-world supervised experiences and case studies.
Year 1: Year 1 focuses on foundational aspects of integrative counselling and psychotherapy. Students delve into core theoretical frameworks, such as person-centered therapy, attachment theory, and cognitive behavioral therapy, exploring their application in diverse therapeutic contexts.  Emphasis is placed on developing foundational skills like active listening, empathy, and building therapeutic relationships.  Students also start to integrate theoretical understanding with practical experience while completing initial recorded assignments with an actor.
Year 2: Year 2 builds upon the foundation established in Year 1, deepening theoretical knowledge and advancing practical experience. Students engage in more complex case studies, further developing their clinical skills in diverse settings.  Advanced research methods are integrated, enabling students to critically evaluate existing literature and conduct research relevant to the field. This year is more practical focused, with increased direct interaction with clients under professional supervision.
Year 3: Year 3 (part-time students only) involves more of the advanced clinical work and the completion of the dissertation.  This stage involves independent research and scholarly writing, enhancing scholarly skills and preparing students for more autonomous clinical practice. Professional practice modules continue and students work on the dissertation and refine their research and critical thinking on specific areas of integrative counselling and psychotherapy.

Course Title: BSc (Hons) Integrative Health and Social Care (Top-Up)
Entry Requirement: Entry requirements for this top-up BSc (Hons) include 240 credits at Level 5 in a related subject area such as health and social care, social work, health promotion, or youth work.  Acceptable qualifications also include ATHE Level 4 and 5 in Management for Health and Social Care (equivalent to 240 credits).  Applicants whose first language isn't English need an IELTS score of 6.0.  For Pakistani students,  the University's website states general requirements for undergraduate programs, including A-levels or the International Baccalaureate (IB) from recognized Pakistani international schools for first-year entry.  There is no specific mention of Pakistan-specific requirements for this Top-Up degree.
Overview: The BSc (Hons) Integrative Health and Social Care (Top-Up) is an online program designed for health and social care professionals seeking to enhance their skills and knowledge.  The curriculum focuses on integrative care, encompassing leadership, management, mental health, wellbeing, and public health.  It prepares students to lead developments and implement positive changes within their organizations, addressing the evolving needs of the sector. The course emphasizes inter-professional collaboration, policy development, and strategic thinking to improve patient, client, and community outcomes. Students benefit from flexible online learning, supported by an academic team that provides guidance and support throughout their studies. The program is assessed through 100% coursework, using a variety of methods such as essays, reports, and presentations.
Course Structure: The course requires successful completion of six 20-credit modules. This includes three core modules covering fundamental aspects of integrative health and social care and three optional modules allowing for specialization within the field.  The specific modules may change as the university regularly reviews and updates its curriculum. The program structure is designed to be flexible and adaptable to each student's needs and time commitments, with students able to choose whether to study at a standard pace or an accelerated rate.  The university provides various learning resources, including virtual classrooms and online materials, to help students achieve the best possible learning experience.

Course Title: MSc Integrative Health and Social Care
Entry Requirement: A bachelor's degree or equivalent in a relevant subject is required, along with work experience in a related field and current employment in a relevant setting (voluntary, public, private, community, or acute health and social care). International qualifications need to be mapped to the UK equivalent.  For those whose first language isn't English, specific English language qualifications are required such as IELTS 7.0, TOEFL scores of 600 (paper-based), 250 (computer-based), or 100 (internet-based), Pearson Test of English (66), Cambridge Advanced Certificate (pass), or equivalent.  For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university in Pakistan is required, equivalent to at least a UK 'Upper Second Class (2:1)' or 'Lower Second Class (2:2)' degree.  Those with a two- or three-year Bachelor's degree also need a Master's degree.  A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors (minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00) from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable.
Overview: The University of Derby's online MSc in Integrative Health and Social Care provides a flexible postgraduate qualification tailored to individual needs. Designed with input from leading specialists, it focuses on delivering effective healthcare, inter-agency collaboration, policy development, and strategic direction within various health and social care settings globally. The program emphasizes practical application, incorporating current research and government initiatives. Students benefit from expert academics, online learning resources, and opportunities for international collaboration. The flexible structure allows students to balance their studies with work and personal commitments, enabling completion within 2-3 years or at a faster pace depending on individual preferences.
Course Structure: The MSc comprises core modules and optional modules allowing students to choose a pathway that aligns with their career aspirations. Students can opt for a Postgraduate Certificate (3 modules), a Postgraduate Diploma (6 modules), or the full MSc.  Modules may include Leadership and Management in Health and Social Care, along with others that focus on specific areas within integrative health and social care.  The course uses a variety of assessment methods, including essays, research reports, presentations, group work, and practical reports. All assessments are coursework-based. The course reviews its content to constantly improve the student experience and graduate prospects.

Course Title: MSc Intelligence, Security and Disaster Management
Required IELTS Score: 6.5 with 5.5 in each skills area
Entry Requirement: For the MSc, a 2:2 or above undergraduate degree in social sciences (criminology, sociology, psychology, international relations, policing, criminal justice), natural sciences (geography, earth sciences), health, business studies, or economics is usually required.  Applicants whose first language isn't English will also need an IELTS score of 6.5 with at least 5.5 in each skill.  Those without a degree but with substantial professional experience may be considered based on their personal statement, references, and interviews with the program leader.  For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university, equivalent to a UK 'Upper Second Class (2:1)' or 'Lower Second Class (2:2)' degree is needed. Those with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees must also have a Master's degree pass. A Bachelor's degree with honors (four-year BA, BBA, BSc, BEng) and a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable.
Location/Campus: Kedleston Road and One Friar Gate Square, Derby Campus
Annual Tuition Fee: £16,900 for the full course (Full-time), £1,080 per 20 credits (Part-time)
Overview: The MSc Intelligence, Security and Disaster Management is a postgraduate program designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of intelligence, security, and disaster management.  The curriculum integrates insights from social sciences, natural sciences, and public and environmental health to address contemporary issues like terrorism, security threats, disruptive events, climate change, and humanitarian assistance. The program blends theoretical knowledge with practical skills development through experiential learning, such as seminars, role-playing, and field trips. Students will also participate in service learning (research, community engagement, volunteering) and creative learning (simulation exercises, design thinking). The program is recognized by the UK National Security Secretariat and listed on the Crisis Management Excellence Programme (CMEP).
Course Structure: The MSc comprises three stages: Postgraduate Certificate, Postgraduate Diploma, and MSc.  The Postgraduate Certificate includes the core module 'Introducing Risk and Managing Disasters' and optional modules such as Health Protection, Understanding Radicalisation, and Geoscience and Security.  The Postgraduate Diploma features the core module 'Research and the Skilled Practitioner' and optional modules including Global Environmental and Public Health, Contemporary Issues in Intelligence and Security, Concepts of Global Terrorism, and Disasters and Humanitarian Aid Response.  The MSc culminates in an independent research study (60 credits) on a chosen topic within intelligence, security, disaster, or crisis management.
Year 1: The first year of the full-time MSc Intelligence, Security and Disaster Management program covers foundational modules in risk management, disaster response, and related fields.  Students will explore various aspects of risk analysis, emergency preparedness, and the application of intelligence gathering techniques in disaster situations. Option modules will allow students to specialize in areas such as health protection, radicalization studies, or geoscience and security.  Assessment is 100% coursework-based and may include essays, presentations, risk assessments and data analysis.
Year 2: The second year, for part-time students, allows for continued specialized study and builds on the skills and knowledge learned in year one. This year incorporates advanced modules in areas such as global environmental and public health,  contemporary issues in intelligence and security, concepts of global terrorism,  and disaster and humanitarian aid response.  Students will also embark on their independent research project which will involve in-depth study of a chosen topic, culminating in  a substantial dissertation demonstrating advanced research and analytical skills.

Course Title: BA (Hons) Interior Architecture and Venue Design
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points, A Levels BBC, T Level Merit, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or equivalent, or a Pass in Access to HE Diploma with specific credit and grade requirements.  International students need an IELTS of 6.0 with at least 5.5 in each skill.  For Pakistani students, A-levels or IB from Pakistani international schools allow entry into Year 1.  Postgraduate entry requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class Honours degree, and possibly a Master's degree if the Bachelor's is only two or three years. A four-year Bachelor's with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.0 from a recognized Pakistani university is also considered for Master's entry. PhD applicants from Pakistan must hold a Master's and Bachelor's degree in a relevant subject and submit a research proposal.
Overview: The BA (Hons) Interior Architecture and Venue Design course at the University of Derby equips students with the skills and knowledge to create innovative designs for various venue spaces.  The program emphasizes a studio-based learning approach, utilizing excellent facilities and expert faculty.  Students develop spatial, aesthetic, and communication skills while understanding professional practice, collaboration, and intellectual property protection. Live project briefs provide real-world experience, culminating in an end-of-year exhibition. The course is accredited by the Chartered Society of Designers (CSD), offering professional credibility and associate membership. Students explore a wide range of design applications from performance spaces and social venues to retail outlets and museums, embracing sustainability and the evolving needs of society.
Course Structure: The course is structured to provide a comprehensive education in interior architecture and venue design.  It blends theoretical knowledge with practical application, using a studio-based approach.  Students will explore various design principles, construction methods, materials, and technical aspects of creating innovative interior spaces. The curriculum also covers professional practices, collaboration, and project management. The program includes live project briefs, collaborations with industry professionals, and opportunities for placement years.  The course culminates in a final year dissertation and design project showcasing the students' skills and knowledge.
Year 1: Year one establishes foundational skills in design concepts, construction techniques, and basic architectural and drawing skills.  Students will undertake introductory modules covering basic design principles, drawing, CAD software, history of design and the principles of space planning. They might participate in introductory workshops and design projects that familiarizes them with materials and construction processes.
Year 2: In the second year, students deepen their understanding of interior design principles. They focus on more advanced design projects, exploring different design styles and methods.  The curriculum may cover building regulations, sustainable design elements, advanced design software and techniques, and material application. A placement year option is available for students, providing real-world work experience.
Year 3: The final year involves a major design project based on a real or hypothetical commission from a client, offering significant creativity and autonomy. Students engage in advanced design research, building design specifications, and presenting projects with professional materials. Modules might focus on dissertation writing, developing a professional portfolio and preparing for employment.
Year 4: A placement year is an optional fourth year for full-time students, giving them practical experience and industry insight. This involves working in a relevant professional setting, either in an architectural firm, interior design studio, or with a construction company. Students can apply skills learned during the first two years of study to real world situations, deepening theoretical understanding.

Course Title: Undergraduate Interior Architecture and Venue Design with Foundation Year BA (Hons)
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 72 UCAS points, A Levels (DDD), a T Level pass, BTEC (MMP), GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or a pass in an Access to HE Diploma.  International students need an IELTS score of 6.0 with at least 5.5 in each skill.  For Pakistani students completing A-Levels or IB from International Schools in Pakistan, direct entry into Year 1 is possible.  Those with a relevant Bachelor’s degree from a recognized Pakistani university (equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class degree) can apply for postgraduate programs. A four-year Bachelor's degree with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 may be sufficient.  Students with two- or three-year Bachelor's degrees need to have a Master's degree as well. PhD applicants require both a Master's and Bachelor's degree in relevant fields and need to submit a research proposal.
Overview: The Interior Architecture and Venue Design BA (Hons) with Foundation Year at the University of Derby is a four-year (or five-year with placement) program designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge to design diverse venues, from restaurants and bars to hotels and museums.  The curriculum emphasizes hands-on learning through real-world projects, utilizing actual sites and fostering collaboration with industry partners. Students gain professional credibility through accreditation by the Chartered Society of Designers (CSD) and affiliation with the British Institute of Interior Design (BIID). The program focuses on developing socially, culturally, and environmentally responsive designs, incorporating historical and theoretical knowledge into practical applications.  Students benefit from expert teaching, excellent facilities including advanced design software and workshops, and strong employer links leading to numerous career opportunities in hospitality, leisure, retail, and corporate sectors.
Course Structure: The course structure involves a foundation year to strengthen skills and knowledge, followed by three years of the honors degree. The curriculum is designed with input from industry professionals, ensuring relevance, preparing students for a successful career. This approach is supported by collaborations with local businesses and global organizations offering real-world design projects and opportunities such as placements. Studio-based projects use local sites, enhancing the practical learning experience. Throughout the program, students are assessed in a variety of ways to refine their presentation and communication skills. The curriculum encompasses a wide range of venue design possibilities, from bars and restaurants to hotels and high-end residential properties. It also includes other spaces like live performance areas, community centers, galleries, and retail outlets, offering a comprehensive education across various sectors.
Year 1: The first year might include introductory modules in design principles, drawing techniques, spatial analysis, architectural history and theory, and possibly some basic construction and building technology.  The foundation year also offers tailored support from staff to boost skills and confidence before progressing to the honors degree.
Year 2: The second year typically builds upon the foundation year, delving into more advanced design concepts, construction detailing, materials, and technical drawing. Students will likely start working on larger-scale projects involving more complex spatial planning and design challenges. They may also gain experience in utilizing  3D modeling software, and potentially be introduced to sustainable design and environmental considerations.
Year 3: Year three typically involves focused design studios where students engage in more complex projects, putting their skills into practice.  They may specialize to greater depths on a particular interest within the broader field of Interior Architecture and Venue Design.  This year typically includes more advanced technical modules, possibly including professional practice and business management aspects associated with Architectural design.  A placement year may also be undertaken at this stage.
Year 4: The final year often culminates in a major design project that could be professionally oriented, providing a portfolio piece for job applications. Additional modules may include professional development or advanced research methods, and students will likely participate in exhibitions showcasing their final year work. The year involves the completion of the final degree project alongside additional modules to prepare you for a professional environment. This year will also likely include time to create a portfolio.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical entry requirements include 120 UCAS points, A Levels (BBB), a Merit in T Levels, a DDM in BTECs, and GCSEs in Maths and English at Grade 4/C or above.  An Access to HE Diploma with 60 credits (45 at Level 3) is also acceptable. Contextual offers may be available for students meeting specific criteria.  A portfolio is recommended.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or the International Baccalaureate from international schools in Pakistan, direct entry into the first year is possible.  For postgraduate programs, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized Pakistani university (equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class degree) is usually required, along with a Master's degree if the Bachelor's was a two or three-year program. A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors and a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani university may be considered for entry to a Master's. PhD applicants are expected to hold both masters and bachelor's degree in relevant fields.
Annual Tuition Fee: UK: £9,535 per year; International: £16,900 per year
Overview: The BA (Hons) Interior Design course at the University of Derby aims to equip students with the skills and knowledge needed for a successful career in interior design.  The program covers a wide range of topics, from residential and commercial interior design to set-stage and exhibition design. It emphasizes environmentally responsible design and experiential design considerations.  Students will learn to use spatial qualities, materials, lighting, color, and architectural components effectively. Collaboration, both nationally and internationally, plays a significant role in the curriculum, alongside practical experience through live projects and design competitions.  The course is dynamic, encouraging student individuality while imparting technical proficiency and professional skills.
Course Structure: The course is structured around a series of modules and projects across three years. The curriculum blends theoretical study and practical application, using design studios and real-world projects to provide hands-on experience.  Students receive industry-standard software training, including BIM, and benefit from collaborations with other disciplines and national/international partners.  Assessment is entirely coursework-based,  including practical work, presentations, written assignments and a final-year dissertation.  Students participate in design competitions and have their work showcased at events such as Free Range London.
Year 1: The first year lays the foundation for the program, introducing core principles and techniques in interior design.  Students engage in fundamental design projects, develop their drawing and modeling skills, learn about materials and construction, and explore foundational design theories and practices.  They also begin to experiment with various design software and familiarize themselves with relevant industry standards and regulations.
Year 2: The second year builds on the foundation of the first year, building upon core concepts in more advanced projects. Students start delving into more specialized areas of interior design, such as exploring different spatial typologies and design applications. A key focus is on developing design skills, improving technical proficiency in modeling and drawing, and preparing portfolios for presentations and potential professional work. BIM training is also introduced in the second year.
Year 3: The final year focuses on independent project work and professional practice. Students undertake a substantial self-negotiated project, often involving collaboration with industry partners or real-world clients.  This year also incorporates a dissertation, allowing in-depth investigation of a chosen area of interior design.  The final year culminates in the major University and London Graduate Shows, showcasing completed projects and professional skills.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical requirements include 72 UCAS points, A Levels (DDD), T Level (Pass), BTEC (MMP), or a Pass in an Access to HE Diploma.  GCSE Maths and English are preferred but not mandatory.  A portfolio is recommended.  Contextual offers may apply to students from disadvantaged backgrounds (care experienced, estranged families, refugees, asylum seekers, or those with parents/carers in the UK armed forces).  International students will need to meet specified English language requirements.  For Pakistani students, A-levels or IB from Pakistani International Schools allow entry into Year 1. Postgraduate entry from Pakistan requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to at least a UK 2:1 or 2:2, possibly including a Master's degree if the Bachelor's is 2 or 3 years. A four-year Bachelor's with a minimum 2.4/4.0 GPA may suffice for a Master's program. PhD applicants will need a Master's and Bachelor's with a research proposal.
Annual Tuition Fee: UK: £9,250 per year; International: £16,900 per year
Overview: The University of Derby's Interior Design with Foundation Year BA (Hons) is a four-year program designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary for a successful career in interior design.  The course covers a wide range of topics, including spatial design principles, material selection, lighting design, color theory, and building regulations. Students will learn to create functional and aesthetically pleasing spaces that are both environmentally responsible and user-friendly.  The program incorporates practical experience through live projects and collaborations with national and international partners and is accredited by SBID, affiliated with IE, and has teaching staff affiliated with the BIID.     Students develop skills in 2D and 3D representation, prototyping, and visual documentation crucial for professional settings.  The program emphasizes hands-on experience and prepares students for a variety of careers in the field by promoting collaboration and providing access to top-class facilities.
Course Structure: The course is structured to provide students with a strong foundation in design principles and practices.  The curriculum includes modules covering a wide range of topics, such as design history and theory, design methods,  technical drawing and modeling in 2D and 3D, material and construction techniques, lighting and color theory, building regulations and sustainability.  Students will engage in various design projects in different spatial typologies (residential, commercial, hospitality, etc.), explore adaptive reuse and regenerative design principles, and develop their professional skills through portfolio creation, presentations,  and collaborations with other disciplines (both national and international).  The final year includes independent project development and, optionally, the composition of a dissertation.
Year 1: The first year focuses on building fundamental design skills and knowledge. Students will learn the basics of design drawing, modeling, and presentation techniques, as well as explore design history and theory.  Introductory modules in materials, construction, and building regulations will lay a strong foundation for the years to come. Students begin with foundational elements that familiarize the students with design thinking, drawing practice, and material exploration.  The fundamental skills are honed through several studio-based projects which allow for a deeper understanding and creativity.
Year 2: In the second year, students will deepen their understanding of design principles and begin to specialize in specific areas of interest.  Building on the foundation established in Year 1, students build up their skills through technical drawing, detailed design project development, and exploration of contemporary design theory.  They will begin focusing on broader spatial typologies such as residential versus commercial interiors and begin using Building Information Modeling (BIM) software. The year also offers the chance to participate in live projects which add to the student's professional portfolio.
Year 3: The third year focuses on advanced design practices and project management. Students will work on increasingly complex projects, developing their ability to manage projects from concept to completion.  The year provides opportunity to participate in national or international vertical studio projects in collaboration with peers.  Students will learn skills in advanced 3D modeling and rendering, advanced material selection, and design communication. Alongside a focus on the practical application of design skills, students continue to deepen their engagement with contemporary design practice, theory and philosophy.
Year 4: The final year builds upon the skills acquired over the previous years, culminating in a major self-negotiated, independent creative project.  Students refine skills in design management and have the option to write a dissertation based on self-selected areas of research. The year includes a focus on professional practice, such as preparing portfolios, networking and job applications.   Students present their major project and are given an opportunity to showcase their final body of work at the Degree Show and potentially Free Range in London.

Graduates will be well-prepared for demanding careers across various sectors and will possess the analytical and problem-solving skills needed for leadership roles. Students also develop strong business acumen and international business awareness, a combination necessary for success in today's globalized marketplace.

It covers topics such as international financial reporting standards (IFRS), multinational accounting, taxation in different jurisdictions, global financial markets, and ethical considerations in international business.  Students gain practical experience through case studies, real-world projects, and potentially industry placements to enhance their employability. The program is structured to provide a thorough understanding of international accounting standards, regulations, and best practices. Students develop essential analytical skills, data proficiency, and communication skills needed to excel in international finance roles. The course incorporates a blend of theory and practice, providing students with the necessary knowledge and skills to navigate the complexities of international accounting.

Overview: The MSc International Business and Finance is a dynamic program designed to equip students with a thorough understanding of business and finance operations in an international context. It integrates economics, international business strategy, finance, and behavioral finance, exploring international trade, global financial markets, regulation, financial performance evaluation, and the psychology of financial decision-making.  The program emphasizes hands-on learning through consultancy projects, case studies, company visits, guest lectures, and mentoring opportunities with international business leaders. Students gain practical experience, statistical, modeling, and research skills, leading to an impressive portfolio of transferable skills.  The program also fosters personal and career development, with opportunities to earn the Bloomberg Market Certificate and the unique Futures Award in Leadership in International Business.  Graduates are prepared for various global career paths.
Course Structure: The MSc consists of taught modules and independent study components.  The Postgraduate Certificate requires 60 credits, the Postgraduate Diploma 120 credits, and the full MSc 180 credits. Modules cover international economics for business and finance; strategic finance and investment behavior; strategic and financial performance management; HRM in an international context; customer behavior and decision-making; international business theory and strategy; international banking and finance law; mergers and acquisitions; international finance; and advanced diversity and inclusion. The program culminates in an independent research dissertation.
Year 1: The first year of the full-time MSc incorporates a blend of core modules such as International Economics for Business and Finance, Strategic Finance and Investment Behaviour, and Strategic and Financial Performance Management.  Students also explore HRM in an International Context, Customer Behaviour and Decision Making and potentially other elective options depending on the year and schedule.

Required IELTS Score: 6.5 with 5.5 in each skills area
Entry Requirement: A second class or higher undergraduate degree in a relevant area including business, economics, management, HRM, or another degree with sufficient relevant business experience is usually required. If English is not your first language, IELTS 6.5 with 5.5 in each skills area is also needed.  For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor’s degree from a recognized University in Pakistan, equivalent to at least a UK ‘Upper Second Class (2:1)’ or ‘Lower Second Class (2:2)’ degree, is necessary.  Those with two or three-year Bachelor degrees must also have a pass in a Master’s degree. A Bachelor's degree with honors (four-year BA, BBA, BSc, BEng) with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani University is considered for Masters entry.
Overview: The MSc International Business and HRM program provides a comprehensive understanding of business and human resource management within a global context.  It equips students with the necessary skills and knowledge for successful careers in business or HR, emphasizing strategic knowledge for today's interconnected business world. The curriculum blends economics, international business strategy, employment law, leadership, and talent management. Students will develop expertise in evaluating HRM decisions and operations in international organizations, enhanced by real-world case studies and applied research.  Networking opportunities with international business leaders and HR professionals through guest lectures, mentoring, and collaborations with organizations like Lloyds Bank and Price Waterhouse Cooper are integral to the program.
Course Structure: The MSc International Business and HRM is structured in three stages: Postgraduate Certificate, Postgraduate Diploma, and MSc.  The Postgraduate Certificate covers modules like International Economics for Business and Finance, Market Analysis, Strategic and Financial Performance Management, Leading, Managing and Developing People, and HRM in an International Context. The Postgraduate Diploma includes modules such as International Business Theory and Strategy, International Resourcing and Talent Development, Advanced Diversity and Inclusion, and Strategic Employment Relations. The MSc stage culminates in an Independent Study project, involving research methods and a dissertation, allowing students to focus on specific areas of interest within international HRM.  Students can also participate in the Futures Award in Leadership in International Business, engaging in extracurricular activities to enhance their leadership and consultancy skills.
Year 1: The first year of the full-time MSc International Business and HRM program involves completing the Postgraduate Certificate modules. Students will study International Economics focusing on macroeconomics of open economies, international trade, and the financial environment. Market analysis skills using quantitative and qualitative data are developed. Strategic and Financial Performance Management focuses on financially-based performance metrics.  The program also explores Leading, Managing and Developing People, evaluating HRM research and practices, and HRM in an International Context, examining how organizations respond to external and internal forces.
Year 2: The second year (for full-time students) or the first year (for part-time students) will focus on the Postgraduate Diploma modules. Students will delve into International Business Theory and Strategy, exploring globalization's impact on organizations' strategies. International Resourcing and Talent Development examines talent management strategies.  Advanced Diversity and Inclusion explores strategic workplace diversity and inclusion, addressing behaviour and the role of stakeholders in promoting a fair workplace culture.  Strategic Employment Relations explores different perspectives of employment relations, power, and conflict within organizations.
Year 3: The third year (for part-time students) focuses on the MSc level, consisting of an Independent Study with two components: Research Methods (20 credits) and Dissertation (40 credits). This provides an opportunity for in-depth research and critical analysis within the student's chosen area of international HRM. Students typically select a dissertation topic reflecting their career ambitions, which includes literature review, methodology, data collection, analysis, and findings.  They also receive guidance on refining their topic and carrying out the research methods appropriately.

Overview: The BSc (Hons) International Business Management is a three-year undergraduate program designed to equip students with a comprehensive understanding of international business principles and practices.  The curriculum covers diverse areas like business management, economics, accounting and finance, marketing, human resource management, logistics, enterprise, IT, and technology. Students develop strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills applicable in the global marketplace.  The program also includes a study abroad period to offer firsthand exposure to international business operations and different cultures. Students benefit from a state-of-the-art Financial Markets Lab, providing real-time financial data and tools for practical application.  The course is accredited by professional bodies such as CIMA and CMI, enhancing career prospects and offering exemptions from professional qualifications. The program promotes employability skills through placements, internships, and opportunities for extracurricular career development, preparing graduates for a wide range of roles in the global business world.
Course Structure: The course is structured across three years (full-time) or six years (part-time). The first year provides a foundational understanding of all aspects of international business management, including micro and macroeconomics, quantitative analysis, global business and sustainability, human resources, finance, and business performance. Subsequent years offer specialized pathways in economics, finance, supply chain and logistics, or business technology, with approximately one-third of modules dedicated to the chosen specialization. Students who opt for the general International Business Management pathway develop a broader skillset while still having the opportunity to explore specialist areas through optional modules.  Regardless of the chosen pathway, students gain a strong grounding in key areas like economics, data analysis, sustainability, project management, finance, and business strategy.  The curriculum features a blend of interactive lectures, problem-solving seminars, group work, workshops, case study analysis, and computer lab work.  Assessment methods utilize computer-based assessments, essays, reports, presentations, data analysis, and reflective portfolios.
Year 1: The first year provides a broad foundation in international business management.  Core modules cover micro and macroeconomics, quantitative analysis, global business and sustainability, human resources management, finance, and business performance. This introductory year is designed to allow students to explore different aspects of international business and discover their areas of interest before choosing a specialization.
Year 2: In the second year, students can choose to study abroad for a semester.  Those electing a specialist pathway will begin focusing more on their chosen subject (economics, finance, supply chain and logistics, or business technology).  Around one-third of the modules will be dedicated to the chosen area of expertise. Students pursuing the general International Business Management pathway get additional optional modules from across all pathways and can also take subjects such as Marketing and Enterprise to further broaden their skillset.
Year 3: The third year builds upon the knowledge and skills acquired in previous years.  Students in specialized pathways continue their focused study within their chosen specialization.  The modules will offer opportunities to apply learned knowledge to real-world business scenarios, through case studies, simulations, and practical projects.  For the core international business management pathway there will be optional modules that allow students to further increase their expertise in various fields, thereby developing a well-rounded knowledge base across a variety of international business disciplines.  The aim is to deliver graduates with a comprehensive skill set and ability to succeed in roles in a multitude of sectors.
