Overview: The BA (Hons) Marketing, PR and Advertising degree at the University of Derby provides a comprehensive understanding of marketing, branding, and communication concepts.  The program emphasizes practical application through hands-on projects, internships, and real-world company briefs.  Students develop skills in campaign planning, execution, and analysis, learning to build strong brand images and understand their impact on profitability. The course is accredited by the Chartered Institute of Marketing (CIM), offering exemptions towards the CIM Diploma in Professional Marketing.  Graduates will possess a strong professional digital portfolio built through their coursework and practical experiences. The program also fosters networking opportunities within the industry.
Course Structure: The course covers a wide range of marketing, PR, and advertising topics, including but not limited to branding, consumer behavior, communications strategy, campaign planning and execution, digital marketing, social media management, market research, advertising design, and public relations. Students participate in lectures, seminars, workshops, group projects, individual assignments, company projects, field trips, exhibitions, and potentially internships. The assessment methods are varied and include coursework, reports, presentations, creative outputs (infographics, ads, films), and online assessments.  The course structure evolves to provide a balance of group work to simulate real-world collaboration and independent work to develop critical thinking and research capabilities.
Year 1: The first year introduces foundational concepts in marketing, PR, and advertising.  Students will explore essential theories and principles, covering topics like marketing communications, consumer behavior, branding and brand management, market research techniques, introduction to digital marketing and various advertising channels. They begin to develop practical skills through introductory assignments involving marketing plans, campaign creative and preliminary data analysis. First year projects and assessments will lay the groundwork for more complex work in subsequent years.
Year 2: Year two builds upon the foundational year by providing deeper engagement with specialized areas such as digital marketing strategy, social media marketing; marketing analytics, public relations campaign management, creative brand development. Students will undertake more complex projects, perhaps involving client briefs, requiring advanced planning, execution, and analytical skills. Assessments may involve creating marketing campaigns, conducting audience analysis, and writing reports on campaign performance, further developing the professional portfolio.
Year 3: The final year deepens the students' understanding in the field. It provides specialization and focus on strategic marketing management, integrated marketing communications, and campaign evaluation. Students may specialize area of interest through projects, and build upon their strategic and analytical abilities. This involves independent research projects, potentially producing work for real clients and culminating in a final year project designed to showcase both theoretical knowledge and hands on application skills.

Entry Requirement: For the Materials Science Technologist Degree Apprenticeship, employment for at least 30 hours per week is mandatory, and the employer must cover apprenticeship costs.  Employers typically set their selection criteria, but generally, applicants need level 3 qualifications such as A-Level Maths and A-Level Chemistry, Physics, or Engineering. Five GCSE passes are required, including Maths, English, and Science.  For Pakistani students seeking undergraduate admission, A-levels or the International Baccalaureate from Pakistani international schools are acceptable.  Postgraduate applicants from Pakistan must possess a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class degree.  Those with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees also need a Master's degree pass. A four-year Bachelor's with honors and a minimum 2.4/4.00 GPA from a recognized Pakistani university is considered for Master's entry. PhD applicants from Pakistan need both master's and bachelor's degrees in relevant subjects, along with a research proposal.
Overview: The Materials Science Technologist Degree Apprenticeship is a four-year, part-time program designed to produce materials technologists for various engineering sectors, including manufacturing, transportation, construction, petrochemicals, nuclear, and materials failure analysis. Developed in collaboration with Rolls-Royce and other companies, it balances academic concepts, practical workplace learning, and professional body requirements.  The program provides a foundation in materials engineering principles, enabling graduates to optimize materials for design, selection, production, and sustainable resource use.  Apprentices will develop skills in areas such as rheology, traditional and advanced ceramics, and material failure analysis.  The program also emphasizes ethical considerations and sustainable practices within a global context.  Successful completion leads to a professional qualification.
Course Structure: The four-year apprenticeship combines off-the-job and on-the-job learning.  Year one introduces fundamental concepts, including applied scientific methods, materials data skills, CAD, manufacturing processes, thermodynamics, and business management. Year two builds upon these foundations with advanced analytical methods, materials properties and processing, structural analysis, investigation techniques, and corporate responsibility. Year three delves into forensic investigation of materials failures, composite materials, technical responsibility, and design for manufacturing.  The final year focuses on independent study, advanced engineering materials, and professional development.  An e-portfolio assessment is part of the Gateway Assessment for the End Point Assessment (EPA), conducted independently by an EPAO.
Year 1: The first year covers Applied Scientific Methods, which lays the groundwork for practical application of scientific principles in material science.  Materials Data Skills and Personal Development Planning equip students with essential data handling and self-management techniques. Computer Aided Design (CAD) introduces essential software and design skills. Materials and Manufacturing Processes covers the theoretical and practical aspects of how materials are made and formed.  Thermodynamics provides a foundation in energy and heat transfers, important in many materials contexts. Finally, Business Management and Regulations touches upon the commercial and legal aspects of the industry.
Year 2: The second year expands on the first year's foundation with Advanced Applied Analytical Methods, which deepens students' data analysis capabilities. Advanced Materials Properties and Processing explores the relationship between material structure, processing, and properties. Structural Analysis and Materials introduces techniques to understand material behavior under stress. Investigation Techniques, Modelling and Materials Characterisation provides advanced analytical tools. Lastly, Corporate Responsibility and Professional Development focuses on ethical and professional aspects.
Year 3: Year three focuses on specialized topics. Forensic Investigation of Materials Failures trains students to diagnose and resolve material defects found in products. Engineering Composite Materials provides a greater understanding of these composite structures.  Technical Responsibility develops leadership and managerial skills, while Design for Manufacturing and Materials Optimisation integrates design and materials selection for optimal production.
Year 4: The final year is dedicated to Independent Study and Professional Development, allowing apprentices to undertake self-directed projects relevant to their chosen specialism within materials science. Advanced Engineering Materials and Applications covers cutting-edge developments in materials science.  This year also includes preparation for the End Point Assessment.

Required IELTS Score: 6.5 (minimum of 5.5 in each component)
Entry Requirement: Applicants typically need a good honors degree (minimum upper second class) from a UK university (or equivalent) in any subject or a comparable professional qualification.  Significant management experience and a substantial achievement record are alternative entry routes.  Those with limited formal qualifications might be considered if they demonstrate sufficient communication, learning skills, knowledge, experience and motivation.  All applications are assessed individually, and interviews may be conducted. For international students whose first language isn't English, specific English language qualifications are required such as IELTS, TOEFL, Pearson Test of Academic English, Cambridge Advanced Certificate, London Tests of English, International GCE O-level English Language, or International GCSE English/English as a Second Language.  Pakistan Requirements: Students must hold a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized Pakistani university, equivalent to at least a UK Upper Second Class (2:1) or Lower Second Class (2:2) degree. Those with two or three-year Bachelor degrees require a Master's degree pass. A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors (minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00) from a recognized Pakistani university also qualifies for entry.
Overview: The University of Derby's Global MBA is a postgraduate program designed to equip aspiring managers and leaders with the strategic knowledge and confidence to excel in international business settings. The curriculum covers strategic leadership, financial management, global operations, markets and resources, business research methods, data analysis, risk management, and global supply chain management. This online MBA allows for application of learned skills to contemporary global business challenges, fostering critical thinking and innovative problem-solving in a global context.
Course Structure: The Global MBA comprises three stages: Stage 1 (Certificate), Stage 2 (Diploma), and Stage 3 (Masters).  Each stage involves completing modules worth 60 credits each, totaling 180 credits. Stage 3 culminates in a dissertation (60 credits). Modules are subject to change based on regular review to improve student experience and graduate prospects.   The course uses a trimester system (three 10-week terms), with a recommended study time of 20 hours per week per 20-credit module. Accelerated options allow for studying two modules per trimester (40 hours per week recommended). Assessment is entirely coursework-based and uses various methods such as essays, research reports, presentations, group work, and practical reports.
Year 1: NA
Year 2: NA

Required IELTS Score: 6.5 with a minimum of 5.5 in all areas
Entry Requirement: Applicants typically need a good honours degree (minimum upper second class) from a UK university (or equivalent) in any subject or a comparable professional qualification.  Significant management experience and a substantial achievement record may also be considered, even without a prior university degree.  Applications are assessed individually, with interviews sometimes required. For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university, equivalent to at least a UK ‘Upper Second Class (2:1)’ or ‘Lower Second Class (2:2)’ degree is required. Those with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees also need a Master's degree. A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors (minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00) from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable.
Overview: The University of Derby's MBA Professional program is designed for working professionals aiming to enhance their leadership capabilities.  This part-time course blends academic study with real-world business scenarios, allowing students to apply their learning directly within their organizations.  The curriculum focuses on developing strategic thinking, vision, and inclusive leadership skills essential in today's dynamic business environment.  The program covers key areas such as marketing, human resource management, financial performance, supply chain, and risk governance.  Students benefit from experienced tutors with strong industry networks, individual academic tutoring support, and flexible study options. The ultimate goal is to equip students with the expertise and skills necessary to excel in senior management roles.
Course Structure: The MBA Professional program is structured in three stages: Postgraduate Certificate, Postgraduate Diploma, and MBA. The Postgraduate Certificate involves modules like Understanding HRM, Information Systems, Business Research Methods, Sustainable Business, Marketing, and Governance and Risk. The Postgraduate Diploma builds upon this foundation with modules on Supply Chain Operations, Strategic and Financial Performance Management, and Critical Perspectives in Strategic Leadership. Finally, the MBA concludes with either a dissertation or a project.  The curriculum is regularly reviewed to ensure alignment with industry demands and student success.
Year 1: The first year of the MBA Professional program focuses on establishing a foundation in core business principles.  Students will explore key areas such as Human Resource Management (HRM), the importance of sustainable business practices within the global environment, and the strategic applications of information systems.  Additionally, foundational knowledge in business research methods, marketing principles, and governance and risk management will be established. This section sets up practical knowledge for later year modules.
Year 2: The second year intensifies the focus on strategic business operations.  Students delve into improving logistics and supply chain management, gaining a deep understanding of how to optimize these crucial aspects of any organization. They also explore and hone their strategic and financial performance management skills, learning to analyze financial data effectively and informing strategic decision-making.  Critical thinking and leadership are further developed with modules on strategic leadership and management.
Year 3: The final year of the MBA culminates in either a dissertation or a project. The dissertation allows for in-depth research into a specific area of business interest, allowing students to apply their learning to a real-world problem or opportunity within their workplace.  The project option would entail a comprehensive investigation into a matter of personal and professional interest, building on the knowledge and skills from the preceding years.

Required IELTS Score: 6.5 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: This top-up program requires an HND or Foundation degree in a relevant subject.  A transcript of previously completed modules must be submitted for compatibility assessment.  For Pakistani students, the entry requirements depend on prior education:  A-levels or IB from recognised International Schools in Pakistan allow entry from the first year. A relevant bachelor's degree from a recognised Pakistani university (equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2) is needed for postgraduate study; a two or three-year bachelor's degree requires a pass in a Master's degree; or a four-year Bachelors degree with honors (minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00) is sufficient.
Overview: The BEng (Hons) Mechanical and Manufacturing Engineering (Top-Up) program at the University of Derby is designed for students with an existing HND or foundation degree in a related field.  This one-year (full-time) or two-year (part-time) course builds upon prior learning to provide a comprehensive education in mechanical and manufacturing engineering.  Students develop strong practical skills in areas including design modeling, computational fluid dynamics, manufacturing automation, and control systems. The program emphasizes the application of current and developing technologies, ethical and environmental considerations, and the development of crucial management and leadership skills. The curriculum incorporates a balance of lectures, projects, seminars, workshops, industrial visits, and guest lectures, catering to students interested in either mechanical or manufacturing engineering specializations.
Course Structure: The course modules blend theoretical knowledge and practical application to promote a thorough understanding of engineering concepts. Students will experience laboratory sessions, utilizing advanced equipment such as 3D printing technology, wind tunnels, and CNC machinery. They will develop problem-solving skills through assignments, examinations, technical reports, and presentations. There is a significant emphasis on project work, allowing for specialization and practical application of the knowledge acquired throughout the program. The top-up structure implies a focus on advanced study building on existing knowledge, culminating in skills necessary for successful practice as professional engineers. The IMechE accreditation pathway is highlighted for potential professional registration as an Incorporated Engineer.
Year 1: In the first year (full-time), students will study modules relevant to either the mechanical or manufacturing engineering pathway.  Mechanical engineering modules might include topics like engineering design modeling, computational fluid dynamics, and materials and applications. Manufacturing engineering modules could cover engineering materials and applications, manufacturing automation and control, and technology and systems.  Both pathways offer project-based learning allowing students to build on acquired knowledge in a practical and focused manner.  Ethical and environmental standards are also incorporated throughout the design processes, enabling the students to prepare themselves as socially and environmentally responsible engineering professionals.
Year 2: NA

Entry Requirement: Applicants typically require an engineering or science undergraduate degree (minimum 2:2) or an equivalent professional qualification.  Significant industrial or professional experience may also be considered.  International students need an ATAS certificate. For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university, equivalent to at least a UK 2:1 or 2:2, is required.  A two- or three-year Bachelor's degree necessitates a Master's degree pass. A four-year Bachelor's degree with honors and a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable.
Overview: The University of Derby's MSc in Mechanical and Manufacturing Engineering is a postgraduate program designed to equip students with advanced skills and knowledge sought after by employers in various engineering sectors. The curriculum focuses on developing expertise in both mechanical and manufacturing engineering principles while providing opportunities to specialize in areas of personal interest.  The program boasts strong industry links with companies such as Rolls-Royce and Toyota, ensuring that learning remains aligned with current industry trends.  Students undertake a substantial research project, providing hands-on experience, and gain valuable managerial skills relevant to global engineering environments.  The program contributes towards Chartered Engineer (CEng) status.
Course Structure: The MSc comprises three stages: Postgraduate Certificate, Postgraduate Diploma, and MSc.  The Postgraduate Certificate includes modules on research methods, advanced mechanical modeling and e-manufacturing, forensic engineering, and environmental risk. The Postgraduate Diploma builds upon this foundation with modules on CPD and strategic management, advanced mechanical design, robotics, and a negotiated module allowing for personalized study. The MSc culminates in an independent scholarship module, a substantial research project allowing for in-depth exploration of a chosen topic within the field.
Year 1: NA
Year 2: NA

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points.  A-Level students need BBC, with at least a C in Maths or Physics.  T-Levels in Maintenance, Installation and Repair or Design and Development for Engineering and Manufacturing, or Engineering, Manufacturing, Processing and Control are accepted. BTEC National Diploma/Extended Diploma in Engineering, Motorsport, or Physics with at least a Merit in Maths is also acceptable. GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or equivalent are required.  An Access to HE Diploma with 60 credits (45 at Level 3) including compulsory Level 3 subjects is an alternative.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or the IB from international schools in Pakistan, direct entry into Year 1 is possible.  Contextual offers may be available for students meeting specific criteria like being care experienced, estranged from their families, refugees, asylum seekers, or having parents/carers in the UK armed forces.
Overview: The University of Derby's BEng (Hons) Mechanical Engineering program is a three-year, full-time course designed to provide students with a multi-disciplinary skillset in mechanical and manufacturing engineering. The curriculum combines core engineering principles with specialized areas such as additive manufacturing, materials testing, and fluid dynamics.  Students gain practical experience through access to state-of-the-art facilities including an additive manufacturing lab, wind tunnel, and mechanical workshop.  The course includes opportunities for industrial placements and participation in competitions like the IMechE Railway Challenge.  Students can also choose to transfer to electrical and electronic engineering or motorsport engineering after the first year.  The program emphasizes close industry links with companies such as Rolls-Royce and aims to equip graduates for success in various engineering sectors.
Course Structure: The course structure involves a combination of theoretical learning and practical application. Year 1 provides a foundation in core engineering principles. Subsequent years build upon this foundation with specialized modules in areas such as design, manufacturing, materials, and thermodynamics.   The program incorporates assessment methods such as coursework, examinations, and professional presentations.  Students can benefit from optional industry placements or internships, supported by the university's Careers and Employment Service.  The teaching staff have extensive industrial experience and bring real-world expertise into the classroom.  The program also incorporates a Personal Academic Tutoring system to offer individual student support.
Year 1: The first year focuses on building a strong foundation in engineering principles.  Students will encounter core modules common to all engineering disciplines at the university, ensuring a broad-based and adaptable skill set.   Students will be introduced to fundamental concepts in mathematics, physics, and engineering design, preparing them for specialized study in later years. Topics like computer-aided design and basic manufacturing processes would also form part of the curriculum for a robust introductory engineering experience.
Year 2: Year 2 deepens the foundation laid in Year 1 by exploring more detailed mechanical engineering concepts. Subjects could include advanced materials science, strengthening their understanding of material properties and selection for various applications.  Further exploration of manufacturing processes would be undertaken and could include modern techniques as well as traditional methods.  Design-focused modules will expand, teaching more advanced CAD software and design techniques.
Year 3: The final year of study provides a more advanced and specialized learning experience integrating industrial relevance and advanced mechanical engineering expertise. There may be modules that allow students to use and create industry-standard designs and concepts, along with case studies to introduce the students to an actual industry-based project.  A final year project, often involving industry collaboration, will allow them to present and showcase the culmination of their skill set.  These advanced modules would build upon the modules and knowledge learned in the previous years.

Course Title: BEng (Hons) Mechanical Engineering with Foundation Year
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical requirements include 72 UCAS points, A Levels (DDD), a T Level pass, BTEC (MMP), GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or a pass in an Access to HE Diploma.  International students may need to meet additional English language requirements.  Specific requirements for Pakistan are as follows: For undergraduate admissions, students completing A-levels or IB from Pakistani international schools can enter the first year. For postgraduate, a relevant bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class is needed (a Master's degree is required if you have a two or three-year Bachelor's degree).   A four-year Bachelor's Honours with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.0 is also considered. For PhD, a Master's and Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, along with a research proposal are needed.
Annual Tuition Fee: £16,900 per year (2025/26) for international students. Full-time only.
Overview: The BEng (Hons) Mechanical Engineering with Foundation Year is a four-year undergraduate program designed to equip students with a strong foundation in mechanical engineering principles and practices. The foundation year helps students build the skills, knowledge and confidence they need.  The program covers a broad spectrum of mechanical engineering, including computer-aided design, structural analysis, vibration and dynamics, thermofluids, computational fluid dynamics, advanced material design and analysis, and advanced thermodynamics.  Students gain practical, hands-on experience through laboratory work, projects, and workshops. The program also includes opportunities for industry placement, which provide valuable real-world experience and enhance employability.  The University of Derby boasts state-of-the-art facilities, such as additive manufacturing labs, materials testing labs and a Makerspace, that help to improve teaching and experience. The course incorporates sustainability, electrification, and automation. Students further develop important skills such as problem-solving, teamwork, and communication through participation in projects and competitions such as the IMechE Design Challenge and the British Model Flying Association Payload Challenge.
Course Structure: The course is structured over four years, starting with a foundation year. In the first year, students gain an essential foundation across engineering disciplines, gaining a broad perspective. After year one it's possible to switch to another engineering course.  Year two onwards focuses on mechanical engineering, incorporating a range of specialist modules.  An optional industry placement further improves practical skills and allows for professional networking opportunities before the final year project provides invaluable experience.  Assessment methods may include coursework, exams, and presentations. The program is designed to meet the evolving needs of the industry, focusing on sustainability, automation, and electrification.
Year 1: The foundation year provides a broad introduction to engineering principles and fundamental concepts across multiple disciplines. Students build a base in maths, core engineering skills, and introductory mechanical engineering before progressing to more specialized modules.  The year aims to provide solid grounding and allows students time to decide whether to continue with Mechanical Engineering or transfer to Electrical and Electronic Engineering or Motorsport Engineering.
Year 2: Year two begins with core modules in mechanical engineering, building upon the foundation year.  Students learn more advanced topics, potentially including in areas like thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and materials science. As part of the course structure, students have the option to switch to Electrical and Electronic Engineering or Motorsport Engineering or continue the mechanical course.
Year 3: The third year of study includes more specialized modules based on mechanical engineering.  Students may undertake modules that cover topics like design, manufacturing processes, advanced materials, or automation.  An optional placement year is also available in this stage, where students gain practical industrial experience.
Year 4: The final year focuses on final-year projects and further specialized mechanical engineering modules, building on the knowledge of previous years.  The final-year project gives students a chance to demonstrate skills to potential employers. Students also complete remaining coursework and are prepared for careers and potential further studies.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points, BBC at A-Level, DMM in BTEC, or a pass in the Access to HE Diploma.  International students will need an IELTS score of 6.0 with at least 5.5 in each skill area.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or the IB from international schools in Pakistan, entry into the first year is possible.  Contextual offers may be available for students who meet certain criteria such as being care experienced, estranged from their families, refugees or asylum seekers, or having parents/carers in the UK armed forces.  Students must declare such criteria on their application.
Location/Campus: Kedleston Road and Markeaton Street, Derby Campus
Annual Tuition Fee: UK: £9,535 per year International: £16,900 per year
Overview: The BA (Hons) Media and Business Management is a three-year joint honors degree program offered by the University of Derby.  It provides a comprehensive education in media studies, encompassing film, television, news media, and digital and social media, while concurrently covering key business and management topics.  The curriculum emphasizes business ethics, digital media innovation, and globalization.  Students develop critical thinking, problem-solving, research, and communication skills highly valued by employers. The course incorporates real-world opportunities, such as placement years, industry projects, and field trips.  Graduates possess skills and knowledge applicable in various industries, enhanced by the CMI Diploma professional qualification.
Course Structure: The course is structured to allow flexibility for students.  In the first year, students study both media and business management equally. At the end of the first year, students will choose to major in one subject, minor in one subject, or equally study both subjects up to the final year. The program includes a variety of teaching methods, including lectures, workshops, seminars, tutorials, screenings, and work-experience projects. Assessment methods vary to adapt to the subjects' differences.  Media modules are assessed through coursework involving practical projects like articles, videos, work-based learning and audience research. Business management modules will include business reports, research projects, presentations, and designs for digital materials.  The program provides access to resources such as a television studio, video editing suites, radio studios, Mac suites and the Adobe Creative Suite.  The university also provides Personal Academic Tutoring to support student academic progress and career goals.  CMI accreditation is provided upon completing specified modules.
Year 1: In the first year, students study both Media and Business Management equally.  The curriculum introduces foundational concepts in media production, analysis, and theory, covering various forms such as television, film and digital media.  Business management will introduce core concepts in accounting, finance, and general business management,  providing a well-rounded introduction of both fields.
Year 2: The second year builds upon the foundation laid in the first year. Students can choose to focus more on either Media or Business Management depending on the pathway they select. Media modules may delve deeper into specialized areas like journalism, digital marketing, or film production.  Business Management may delve deeper into areas such as strategic management, human resource management, marketing, or operations management. This year also presents opportunities for placement or internship programs.
Year 3: The final year allows for further specialization and independent study.  Students will continue to progress with their final year projects while also considering modules chosen in the first two years. For Media students this can include producing short films, creating digital media campaigns, and conducting media research. For Business Management students this can involve running more in-depth business simulations, final reports and conducting consultancy-style work. The year will bring to closure all the major learning aspects while allowing personal development and project-based learning.

Course Title: BA (Hons) Media and Communication with Foundation Year
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical requirements include 72 UCAS points, A Levels (DDD), BTEC (MMP), or equivalent qualifications. GCSE Maths and English are preferred but not mandatory; if lacking, Level 2 Maths and English can be undertaken as part of the course.  Contextual offers may be available for care-experienced students, estranged students, refugees or asylum seekers, or students whose parents/carers are in the UK armed forces.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or the IB from International Schools in Pakistan, entry into Year 1 is possible.  Those with a 4-year Bachelor's degree (BA, BBA, BSc, BEng) with a minimum 2.4/4.0 GPA from a recognized Pakistani university will also be considered for entry.
Overview: The BA (Hons) Media and Communication with Foundation Year is a four-year undergraduate program designed to equip students with practical communication skills for the fast-paced media industry.  The course covers a broad range of topics, from writing and podcasting to scriptwriting, public relations, and social media management.  Students will develop multimedia production skills through coursework, real-world projects, and potential placements, all while learning from industry-experienced tutors with connections to organizations like the BBC and ITV.  The foundation year provides extra support and skill-building for students before progressing to the main degree, making it suitable for career changers or those needing to strengthen their foundation. The program is based at the Markeaton Street campus in Derby and provides access to cutting-edge facilities such as radio studios, television studios, editing suites, and the Adobe Creative Suite.
Course Structure: The course comprises three main years of study following a foundation year.  The foundation year focuses on strengthening core skills and knowledge in media and communications.  Year 1 offers an introductory overview of key concepts and skills such as writing, podcasting, and basic video production.  In Year 2, students specialize in areas like PR, scriptwriting, or advanced audio production and begin to make choices based on future professional goals. The third and final year, includes more advanced project work and often includes working on an extended project for a media organisation. Students can join a student-run agency to gain real experience and make industry connections.
Year 1: The first year offers an introductory overview of key media and communications knowledge and skills. Students learn writing skills, audio podcasting, communication and creativity, and explore the realities of the industry through modules like "Small Screen, Big Ambition". Emphasis is placed on foundational skills relevant to various media channels.
Year 2: Year 2 allows students to specialize, focusing on PR skills, scriptwriting, or expanding their audio skills. Modules such as "Celebrity, Media and Culture," "Interfacing with the Truth," and "Scriptwriting for Film and Screen" offer in-depth exploration of these areas.  Students gain further practical experience and begin developing their specialisations.
Year 3: The final year provides opportunities for independent study and real-world application of acquired skills. Modules such as "The Working Creative," "Represent and Persuade,"  "Ready Player One: Technology, Games and Gamification," and Public Relations and Social Media will enhance students' understanding of their chosen specialisations and prepare them for the work place.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical UCAS points are 112, equivalent to BBC at A-Level, DMM in BTEC, or a GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above.  Contextual offers may be available for care-experienced students, those estranged from their families, refugees, asylum seekers, or those whose parents are in the UK armed forces.  International students must meet specific English language requirements.  For Pakistani students, A-Levels or IB from Pakistani international schools allow direct entry to Year 1. Postgraduate entry requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2, possibly including a Master's degree if the Bachelor's was a shorter duration. A four-year Bachelor's honors degree with a minimum 2.4/4.0 GPA is considered acceptable for Masters entry. PhD applicants require a Master's and Bachelor's degree in a relevant subject alongside a research proposal.
Overview: The BA (Hons) Media and Communication course at the University of Derby is designed to equip students with the practical and theoretical skills needed to succeed in the fast-paced media industry.  The curriculum blends practical production skills with theoretical understanding, covering various aspects of media and communication. Students will develop skills in writing, podcasting, video production, PR, scriptwriting, social media management, and more.  The program includes opportunities for real-world experience through work placements, projects for real clients, and interactions with industry professionals.  The University boasts outstanding facilities, including radio and television studios, editing suites, and access to the Adobe Creative Suite.  The course aims to not just provide a degree, but also valuable industry experience and connections preparing graduates for meaningful employment.
Course Structure: The three-year (full-time) program is structured across three years.  Year 1 provides a foundational introduction to key media and communications concepts and skills.  Year 2 allows students to specialize, focusing on PR, scriptwriting, or audio production.  The final year culminates in a more extensive project for a real media organization. Modules throughout the course delve into diverse areas, including writing skills, podcasting, communication and creativity, celebrity and media culture, scriptwriting, PR and media management, and the exploration of technology in gaming and entertainment.  Real-world applications of skills are integrated throughout the course through workshops, news days, work experience, and lectures from industry professionals. The course reviews and updates its content regularly, to match the demands of the evolving media landscape.
Year 1: The first year offers a broad introduction to media and communication, focusing on fundamental skills and knowledge. Students develop their writing abilities, learn the basics of audio podcasting, explore communication and creativity through practical exercises, and delve into the world of small-screen media production. The modules aim to build a solid foundation in theory and practice, preparing them for further specialization.
Year 2: In the second year, students begin to specialize, choosing from pathways focusing on PR, script writing, or advanced audio skills. Modules explore aspects of celebrity and media culture, media ethics, explore journalistic trends, the entertainment industry, and offer a deeper dive into media management. The opportunity to join the student-run communications agency, gaining real-life PR experience is particularly valuable.
Year 3: The final year challenges students with independent study and a long-term project for a media organization, providing practical professional experience. Modules cover the working world of creatives, public relations in the age of social media, and the role of technology and gaming in media. This year combines theoretical studies with intense practical application, enhancing students' readiness for employment upon graduation.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points, A Levels BBC, T Level Merit, BTEC DMM, and GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above.  An Access to HE Diploma with 60 credits (45 at Level 3) is also accepted. Contextual offers may be available for care experienced students, those estranged from their families, refugees or asylum seekers, or those whose parents/carers are in the UK armed forces.  Students from Pakistan studying A-levels or the IB from International schools in Pakistan can enter the first year. Postgraduate applicants from Pakistan need a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2, with a Master's degree required for two or three-year Bachelor's holders.  A four-year honors Bachelor's with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognised Pakistani university may also be considered for Masters entry.
Overview: The Criminology and Media BA/BSc (Hons) Joint Honours degree at the University of Derby explores the intersection of criminal behavior and media representation. Students investigate the influence of social divisions on media access and portrayal, analyze crime as an individual and social phenomenon, and examine the economic forces shaping media industries.  The program builds skills in media production, writing for various platforms (including digital media), and research. It combines theoretical knowledge with practical experience through partnerships with local and national media organizations. Students can choose to major in either Criminology or Media or study both equally.
Course Structure: The course blends Criminology and Media studies, initially covering both equally in the first year. After the first year, you select whether to major in one subject or continue studying both equally. Criminology modules are taught using lectures, tutorials, group work, and independent learning, and focus on theory and practice, including interaction with courts, prisons, and youth offender centers.  Media modules utilize lectures, seminars, tutorials, screenings, workshops, and project work covering various aspects of media production, writing, and analysis. Assessments include coursework, presentations, essays, reports, digital portfolios, video production, and creative projects.
Year 1: The first year provides a foundation in both Criminology and Media.  Criminology introduces core concepts, theories, and research methods, laying a groundwork for understanding crime and its causes within society. Students also begin to develop research and analytical skills relevant to criminology. The Media portion introduces core concepts and skills associated with media production and analysis. Students will explore different media formats and platforms, learning basic techniques in writing, editing and creating multimodal communications. Students might also cover aspects of media history, theory, and audience studies.
Year 2: In year two, students delve deeper into specialized areas within Criminology and Media, based on their selected major or equal weighting of subjects. Criminology modules may cover topics such as victimology, criminal justice systems, forensic psychology, or specific types of crime. Media-focused modules might offer advanced training in production techniques or specialized areas like journalism, advertising, or public relations.  Students refine skills in research, analysis, and critical thinking within the context of their chosen focus areas.
Year 3: The final year allows for advanced study and specialization within the chosen major or equal weighting of the subjects. Criminology students could explore criminological theory, criminal policy, or specialized forms of criminal behavior. If a student has a Media-based major, the focus might involve more complex production projects, advanced research methods, or specific areas like digital media analysis, investigative journalism or media management. Students will also develop a capstone project or dissertation that demonstrates their in-depth understanding of their area of study, and advanced abilities in writing, analysis, and research communication.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For students entering in September 2025, typical entry requirements include 112 UCAS points, A Levels BBC, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/Grade C or equivalent, or a Pass Access to HE Diploma with 60 credits (45 at Level 3). Contextual offers may apply to students who meet certain criteria, such as being care experienced, estranged from their families, refugees, asylum seekers, or having parents/carers in the UK armed forces.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or the IB from International Schools in Pakistan, entry into the first year of the Bachelor's degree is possible.
Location/Campus: Kedleston Road and Markeaton Street, Derby Campus
Overview: The BA (Hons) Media and English is a joint honors degree program at the University of Derby that allows students to explore the fields of media and English literature in an integrated manner.  The curriculum combines a rigorous study of literature, analyzing its production, consumption, and cultural context, with practical experience in the media industry. Students are exposed to a range of cultural expressions from around the world and various historical periods, enhancing their critical thinking and communication skills. The program balances theoretical foundations with hands-on projects, including work-based learning, workshops, news days, and real-world projects with media organizations. This approach blends academic pursuits with industry standards, preparing students for professional roles in communications, media, and related sectors. Students are assessed through various methods, emphasizing research, presentation, and critical thinking skills over traditional exams.
Course Structure: The course is structured across three years, offering a blend of theoretical and practical modules. Year one provides a foundational understanding of both media and English, introducing core concepts and skills.  Students develop writing, podcasting, and basic video production skills while exploring key literary themes and theories. The second year allows greater specialization. Students can focus on public relations (PR) skills, scriptwriting, or advance their audio production capabilities. They also delve deeper into literary analysis and critical theory. The final year involves a significant long-term project for a media organization, where students apply their accumulated skills and knowledge.  Throughout the program, students have access to state-of-the-art facilities, including television and radio studios, video editing suites, and Mac suites with Adobe Creative Cloud software.
Year 1: The first year offers an introductory overview of media and communications, covering writing, podcasting, and basic video production.  In English, students build foundational skills in literary analysis and critical thinking, exploring various literary genres, writers, and theories. Both subjects have equal weighting, allowing students time to understand their subject matter and explore options for specialization.
Year 2: In the second year, students choose a pathway: either continue studying in both media and English at an equally weighted level or choose to major in one subject, minor in the other, or focus on acquiring PR, Script writing, or Audio skills based on their interests and career goals. This allows for tailored learning, creating tailored experiences suited to their skills and interests. alongside more in-depth analysis of literature within their specialized focus.
Year 3: The final year involves a major project collaborating with a media organization where students are tasked to use all skills developed during the previous years and create a result suitable for professional use or display.  Students will also continue to deepen their understanding of their chosen major subject in both Media and English by engaging with advanced modules and further developing critical and analytical skills specific to their path. These projects showcase their proficiency in both media production and literary analysis.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points, A Levels BBC, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or equivalent, or a Pass Access to HE Diploma.  International students will need an IELTS score of 6.0 with at least 5.5 in each skill area.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or IB from International Schools in Pakistan, direct entry into Year 1 is possible.  Postgraduate entry from Pakistan requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK 2:1 or 2:2, with a Master's degree needed if the Bachelor's is two or three years. A four-year Bachelor's with Honors and a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 is also acceptable for Masters programs. PhD applicants from Pakistan need a Bachelor's and a Master's degree in a relevant field, plus a research proposal.
Location/Campus: Kedleston Road and Markeaton Street, Derby Campus
Overview: The University of Derby's BA (Hons) Media and Marketing is a three-year, full-time joint honors degree program focusing on the dynamic intersection of media and marketing in the digital age.  Students gain practical experience through real-world projects with local and national organizations.  The curriculum emphasizes writing and creativity for various media, including scriptwriting, blogging, journalism, and public relations.  Students develop skills in digital video production, website creation, and social media management, alongside critical thinking, analytical, and research abilities. The program offers a flexible pathway allowing students to major in Media or Marketing or study both equally.
Course Structure: The course is structured to offer a balance of theoretical knowledge and hands-on practical skills.  The first year involves equal study of both media and marketing, providing a foundational understanding.  Subsequent years allow for specialization, with students choosing to major in one subject or continue with an equal balance.  The curriculum includes lectures, tutorials, seminars, practical assignments (creating advertising, blogs, videos, etc.), company visits, work experience, research projects, screenings, and workshops.  Assessment methods are varied, including written reports, scriptwriting, creative media projects, presentations, and online assessments, reflecting the diverse nature of the industry.
Year 1: The first year of the Media and Marketing BA (Hons) provides a foundational understanding of both disciplines.  Students are introduced to core concepts in media production, marketing principles, writing for different media (journalism, PR, digital content), and basic digital media skills (web video, social media). This year's focus helps to build a solid base for subsequent specialization.
Year 2: In the second year, students continue to build on foundational skills, possibly specializing if a degree pathway was chosen after Year 1.  More advanced topics in media and marketing are explored, with an increased focus on applying learned skills to real-world projects. Students may complete company briefs, develop creative marketing campaigns, or engage in advanced writing assignments, depending on their chosen pathway.
Year 3: The final year combines independent study and advanced practical projects mirroring real-world situations. Students are encouraged to deepen their creative outputs, refine their research and analytical skills, manage projects independently, and solidify their understanding of strategic marketing and media planning.  This year emphasizes preparing students for professional roles in the media and marketing industries.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points, A Levels BBC, T Level Merit, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or equivalent qualifications.  An Access to HE Diploma with 60 credits (45 at Level 3) is also acceptable. Contextual offers may be available for care experienced students, those estranged from their families, refugees/asylum seekers, or those whose parents/carers are in the UK armed forces.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or IB from International Schools in Pakistan, entry to Year 1 is possible. Postgraduate entry may require a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to at least a UK Upper Second or Lower Second Class Honours degree, and possibly a Master's degree if the Bachelor's was only two or three years.  A four-year Bachelor's with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 from a recognised Pakistani university might also suffice.
Overview: The BA (Hons) in Sociology and Media is a three-year undergraduate joint honours program offered by the University of Derby.  Students explore the interplay between sociological concepts and media representations, analyzing how identity, class, ethnicity, and other social factors influence media access and portrayal.  The curriculum blends theoretical understanding with practical skills development in various media platforms, including journalism, PR, web content creation, and social media. Students will engage in real-world learning through placements, community projects, guest speakers, and field trips.  The program allows students to choose a major or minor in either Sociology or Media or maintain an even split across both.
Course Structure: The course structure is flexible, allowing students to either equally study both subjects or to choose to major or minor in one subject.  In the first year, students study both subjects equally.  After this they choose a pathway (Sociology and Media, Media with Sociology, or Sociology with Media).  Modules are subject to change but typically cover key themes in sociology and media studies such as political economy, representation, discourse, and identity. Practical elements include writing for various media, creating media projects, and developing digital skills. The program also includes real-world application via work placements, community engagement, and guest lectures from industry professionals.
Year 1: The first year involves an equal split between sociology and media studies modules.  Students are introduced to core sociological concepts and theories, exploring perspectives on social structures, identities, and inequalities.  In parallel, the media side covers fundamental concepts of media production, communication, and analysis, touching upon different media formats and industries. This gives a broad base before students specialize in later years.
Year 2: Year two builds on the foundation of year one; students who have chosen one subject as their major will have  more modules in this subject.  Sociology modules might delve into specific areas like social research methods, social inequality, or the sociology of media.  Media modules might focus on areas like digital media production, journalism ethics, media law, or advertising and marketing. Students continue to develop their practical skills through projects and assignments.
Year 3: The final year allows for deeper study in the chosen major. It involves independent research, project work, and potentially a dissertation or extended project. Students further develop their understanding of the dynamics of the related industries, exploring the philosophical, ethical, and global perspectives of their chosen subject. This culminates in a final project which showcases the students' accumulated knowledge and practical skills.

Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 112 UCAS points, A Levels BBC, BTEC DMM, GCSE Maths and English Grade 4/C or above, or an Access to HE Diploma.  International students will need to meet specific English language requirements, such as an IELTS score of 6.0 with at least 5.5 in each skill area.  Contextual offers may be available for students from certain backgrounds (care experienced, estranged families, refugees, asylum seekers, or parents/carers in UK armed forces).  Students from Pakistan completing A-levels or IB from International Schools can enter Year 1. Postgraduate entry from Pakistan requires a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class Honours degree. A Master's degree might be also needed if only two or three-year Bachelor's degree has been completed. A four-year Bachelor's with a minimum GPA of 2.4/4.00 is sufficient for postgraduate entry from a Pakistani university. For PhD programs, Pakistan applicants need a Master's and Bachelor's degree in related subjects, plus a research proposal.
Annual Tuition Fee: International: £16,900 per year (2025/26); UK: £9,535 per year (2025/26)
Overview: The BA (Hons) Media Content Creation program at the University of Derby is designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in the dynamic world of media. The course explores various aspects of media content creation, including commercial video production, documentary making, non-linear storytelling techniques, media writing and scripting, podcasting, audio design, interactive media, and social media entrepreneurship. Students gain hands-on experience using industry-standard technology in state-of-the-art facilities, such as television and radio studios, editing suites and computer labs with access to Adobe Creative Suite and LinkedIn Learning. The curriculum emphasizes practical application through live briefs with local and national employers and high-profile competitions, preparing graduates for immediate entry into diverse media roles.
Course Structure: The three-year BA (Hons) Media Content Creation program is structured to provide a comprehensive overview of media content creation. Students begin by building foundational skills in studio design, audio cultures, media writing, and media history. They learn the fundamentals of media production, including writing for different media platforms.  Later years focus on developing specialization skills.  Second-year modules include non-linear narratives, podcasting, social media entrepreneurship, augmented realities, and collaborative on-assignment work. The final year culminates in creating advanced portfolios across multiple media formats, including video, documentary, and audio production. Students hone their skills using advanced digital labs and industry tools. The aim is to provide a diverse and in-depth education in multimedia content creation, using a combination of theoretical learning and hands-on practical projects.
Year 1: The first year focuses on foundational skills in media creation. Students begin with "Studio Design and Praxis," learning the practicalities of studio production.  "Dialled In - Audio Cultures" introduces the history and theory behind audio production.  "Writing for the Media" develops skills for both print media and broadcast, while "Media Histories & Context" builds understanding of evolving media landscapes. "The Coded Industries" explores the technological structures underpinning contemporary media.
Year 2: The second year builds upon the foundation, introducing more specialized skills.  "Non-Linear Narratives" explores storytelling techniques beyond traditional formats.  "Podcast Professional" provides advanced training in podcast production and distribution.  "Social Media Cultures & Entrepreneurship" examines the entrepreneurial aspects of creating content for social media.  "Augmenting Realities" considers emerging technologies and their impact on media, while "On Assignment" gives students real-world experience working on industry projects.
Year 3: The final year centers on creating advanced, marketable portfolios. Students develop "Convergent Media Portfolio", showcasing their skills across different media.  "Advanced Promotional Video Portfolio" focuses on creating professional video material for campaigns.  "Advanced Documentary & Factual Production" enables the creation of high-quality documentary work.  "Advanced Audio Design" sharpens advanced audio skills, and "Advanced Digital Labs" enhances proficency using industry-standard software and tools.

Course Title: Undergraduate Media Content Creation with Foundation Year BA (Hons)
Required IELTS Score: 6.0 (with at least 5.5 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For 2025 entry, typical requirements include 72 UCAS points, A Levels (DDD), BTEC (MMP), or equivalent qualifications. GCSEs in Maths and English are preferred but not mandatory; those lacking these can pursue Level 2 Maths and English during the course.  Contextual offers may be considered for care experienced students, those estranged from their families, refugees, asylum seekers, or those whose parents/carers are in the UK armed forces.  For Pakistani students completing A-levels or IB from International Schools in Pakistan, direct entry into Year 1 is possible.  For postgraduate studies from Pakistani universities, a relevant Bachelor's degree equivalent to a UK Upper or Lower Second Class degree is needed.  A Master's degree is also required for those with two or three-year Bachelor degrees.  A four-year Bachelor's degree with a minimum 2.4/4.00 GPA from a recognised Pakistani university is considered for Masters entry.
Annual Tuition Fee: UK: £9,250 per year; International: £16,900 per year
Overview: The Media Content Creation with Foundation Year BA (Hons) is a four-year undergraduate program designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in various media content creation roles. It emphasizes both theoretical understanding and practical applications, allowing students to explore diverse areas like video production, audio design, documentary filmmaking, social media strategies, interactive media, and emerging technologies such as AI and AR. Students learn to identify their niche and enhance professional skills through industry-relevant projects, gaining practical experience using industry-standard equipment and software.  The program aims to foster creative innovation, entrepreneurship and develop professional networks that help build a student's media career.
Course Structure: The course is structured to include a foundation year followed by three years of the honours degree. The foundation year focuses on building core skills in creative practice, studies, technologies, and digital skills.  The subsequent years delve deeper into specific areas such as studio design, audio cultures, media writing, non-linear narratives, podcast production, social media management, augmented reality applications, and various specialized portfolio development.  Students also engage in practical projects that provide real-world experience. The curriculum is regularly reviewed and updated to ensure relevance to industry trends.
Year 1: The first year introduces students to the fundamentals of media content creation, with modules covering Studio Design and Praxis, examining the practical application of media production principles and technologies.  Dialled In - Audio Culture delves into the history and evolution of different audio forms. Writing for the Media focuses on effective writing techniques for media content, while Media Histories & Context ensures foundational historical and contextual understanding.  Finally, The Coded Industries explores the technological underpinnings of digital media production.
Year 2: Year two delves into advanced topics. Non-Linear Narratives explore how to create engaging and captivating stories that go beyond traditional structures.  Podcast Professional provides comprehensive training in podcast production and audio techniques. Students study the impact of social media for entrepreneurial success in Social Media Cultures & Entrepreneurship.  Augmenting Realities explores the application of augmented reality in media settings. On Assignment challenges students to engage in practical projects, working with external media partners on commercial briefs.
Year 3: The third year involves focused portfolio development, encompassing the creation of a Convergent Media Portfolio showcasing students' skills across various media.  Advanced Promotional Video Portfolio helps students strengthen their skills in creating promotional videos for different purposes.  Advanced Documentary & Factual Production guides students through the advanced techniques of documentary-style filmmaking.  In Advanced Audio Design, students enhance their experience in advanced techniques of audio production. Advanced Digital Labs pushes students to apply their knowledge and technical abilities within new and emerging technologies.

Required IELTS Score: Overall: 6.5, with at least 6.0 in each skill area
Entry Requirement: Applicants typically need a 2:1 or above in a science or health-related degree.  IELTS 6.5 (with at least 6.0 in each skill) is required.  Applicants without a 2:1 but with relevant experience may be considered.  For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university, equivalent to at least a UK Upper Second Class (2:1) or Lower Second Class (2:2) is needed. A four-year Bachelor's degree with honours (minimum GPA 2.4/4.00) from a recognized Pakistani university is also acceptable. Students with a two or three-year Bachelor's degree must have a passing Master's degree.  Access to a clinical ultrasound placement (minimum two days/week) is mandatory, with full-time students receiving placements through partner NHS Trusts and part-time placements needing to be sourced independently.
Annual Tuition Fee: £14,900 (International) per year of study. Part-time international fees are not specified.
Overview: The University of Derby's MSc Medical Ultrasound program provides comprehensive training to become an autonomous ultrasound practitioner.  The curriculum covers the physics and technology of ultrasound imaging, along with various clinical applications, such as obstetric, gynecological, and vascular ultrasound.  The program offers both full-time (2 years) and part-time (3-5 years) options to cater to different professional needs.  Students benefit from practical hands-on experience in a state-of-the-art simulation suite and clinical placements, mentored by experienced professionals in the field.  The program is accredited by the Consortium for the Accreditation of Sonographic Education (CASE), ensuring high-quality education aligned with industry standards.
Course Structure: The MSc Medical Ultrasound is a modular program.  Part-time students complete three stages, each comprising 60 credits. Stage one includes 'Principles of Medical Ultrasound' and two chosen 20-credit option modules (at least one clinical). Stage two involves another 60 credits, with at least 20 in a clinical module. Stage three concludes with the Independent Scholarship (40-60 credits). Full-time students complete 120 credits over two years, including a 20-credit research module and the 40-credit Independent Scholarship. Optional modules cover various specialized areas like obstetric, gynecological, vascular, and musculoskeletal ultrasound, along with generic modules on advancing practice and research skills.  Assessment methods vary and include written assignments, exams, and clinical assessments.
Year 1: Year 1 of the full-time program introduces the fundamental principles of ultrasound, including physics, technology, and imaging techniques.  Students complete the 'Principles of Medical Ultrasound' module and start the research module. Additionally, they begin working toward the 40 credit Independent Scholarship module which is completed in year 2. Students select a combination of clinical modules based on their interests such as obstetrics, gynecology, and general medical ultrasound. Part-time students will complete stage 1 modules in year 1.
Year 2: In the full-time program's second year, students focus on advanced clinical applications and complete their dissertation.  They finalize the research module and the Independent Scholarship module. Students will have advanced their practical experience through clinical placements. The program concludes with a comprehensive assessment of their knowledge and practical skills. Part-time students complete stage two and possibly some or all of stage 3 in year 2.
Year 3: Part-time students will complete or finalize their stage 3 studies which includes a large independent project.  The focus will be on consolidating theoretical and practical knowledge, and building on skills developed in previous years.

Required IELTS Score: Overall: 7
Entry Requirement: Applicants must be a Registered Adult Nurse on Part 1 of the NMC Register for at least six months and currently employed by a local trust.  They need an undergraduate degree classification of 2:1 or above in nursing or a related health and social care program; evidence of Level 6 study is also considered.  An Occupational Health Assessment and Enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check are mandatory.  Applicants whose first language isn't English must demonstrate IELTS 7 or equivalent.  For Pakistani students, a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized university, equivalent to at least a UK 'Upper Second Class (2:1)' or 'Lower Second Class (2:2)', is required. Those with two or three-year Bachelor's degrees need a Master's degree pass. A four-year Bachelor's with honors (minimum GPA 2.4/4.00) from a recognized Pakistani university is also considered.
Overview: The University of Derby offers a two-year, full-time MSc Midwifery (Pre-registration) program designed for registered adult nurses with at least six months of experience.  The course provides comprehensive training in midwifery practice, equipping students with the skills and knowledge to provide safe and effective care for women and babies.  It covers antenatal, intrapartum, and postnatal care, including the management of obstetric emergencies and complications. The curriculum emphasizes evidence-based practice and incorporates inter-professional learning opportunities.  Graduates are eligible to register with the Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC) and pursue careers in various healthcare settings.
Course Structure: The MSc Midwifery program is a two-year course split into two academic years. Year one focuses on fundamental midwifery skills and practice, introducing students to standard midwifery procedures and the role of an autonomous practitioner.  Modules include antenatal care, public health, facilitating normal childbirth, postnatal and neonatal care, and clinical practice.  Year two builds on this foundation, developing advanced skills and knowledge in managing complex cases and caring for mothers and babies with unique needs.  Modules cover obstetric emergencies, independent review of midwifery practice, and further clinical practice.  The program combines theoretical learning with extensive practical experience through placements in various healthcare settings, totaling 1800 hours, ensuring students achieve proficiency across the continuum of care.
Year 1: The first year introduces foundational midwifery principles and skills.  Students learn about standard midwifery practices, the autonomous role of the midwife, continuity of care, and case loading. Key modules include Antenatal Care and Public Health in Contemporary Midwifery Practice; Facilitating Normal Childbirth; Principles of Postnatal and Neonatal Care; and Clinical Practice One.  This phase provides a solid groundwork in midwifery theory and practical skills.
Year 2: Building on the first year, the second year enhances students' knowledge and skills in caring for mothers and babies with complex needs, including those with rare or unique conditions. Students engage in further clinical practice in diverse settings, applying theory to real-world scenarios. The modules include Management of Obstetric Emergencies and Complications of Childbirth; Independent Review of Midwifery Practice; and Clinical Practice Two, solidifying practical expertise and advanced midwifery skills.

Required IELTS Score: 6.5 (with at least 6.0 in each skills area)
Entry Requirement: For September 2025 entry, typical requirements include 128 UCAS points.  A-Level students need ABB, with at least a B in Biology, Human Biology, Physics, Chemistry, or Psychology.  T-Level requires a Distinction, including a science subject. BTEC needs DDM with a science-related subject. GCSEs in Maths, English, and Science at grade 4/C or above are mandatory.  An Access to HE Diploma with specific requirements is also acceptable. The Senior Healthcare Support Worker Apprenticeship (maternity route only) can be considered in lieu of other qualifications. Health or care experience is required.  An interview is mandatory. An Enhanced Disclosure & Barring Service certificate and Occupational Health Assessment are needed.  For Pakistani students, A-Levels or IB from Pakistani international schools allow entry. Postgraduate entry requires a relevant Bachelor's degree from a recognized Pakistani university, equivalent to at least a UK Upper Second Class (2:1) or Lower Second Class (2:2) degree.  A Masters degree may also be necessary depending on the type of Bachelors's Degree obtained. A minimum GPA is also required.
Overview: The University of Derby's Midwifery BSc (Hons) is a three-year undergraduate program designed to produce competent, compassionate midwives.  The curriculum blends theoretical study with extensive practical experience, comprising 50% of the course. Students will gain clinical skills through placements in various healthcare settings, including antenatal and postnatal wards, labor wards, and birth centers.  The program adheres to UNICEF UK Baby Friendly standards and emphasizes evidence-based practice, critical thinking, and decision-making in complex situations. Students will learn to support women's wellbeing throughout pregnancy, childbirth, and postpartum, working in partnership with women and collaborating with multidisciplinary healthcare teams. The University boasts excellent facilities, including clinical skills suites, and strong ties with local NHS trusts.
Course Structure: The midwifery program's structure integrates theory and practice.  The theoretical component includes face-to-face and online teaching, along with independent study.   Fifty percent of the course involves hands-on clinical placements in diverse maternity settings, offering around 2300 hours of experience.  The program includes modules covering various aspects of midwifery, such as antenatal, intrapartum, and postnatal care, newborn care, and interprofessional learning.   Assessment methods are diverse, including written assignments, oral exams, OSCEs, written exams, and case studies.  The curriculum is regularly reviewed to enhance student experience and graduate prospects. Students complete the Newborn Infant Physical Examination as part of their training.
Year 1: The first year lays a foundation in midwifery science and practice.  It introduces core concepts in women's health, reproductive biology, anatomy, physiology, and psychology.  Students begin to develop practical skills in basic midwifery procedures, communication, and care delivery.  They begin working in clinical placements, under supervision, gaining exposure to the realities of the profession. Early clinical experiences introduce a foundation of anatomy, physiology, health assessments, and supporting patients.  Interprofessional collaboration and communication are also emphasized in first-year modules.
Year 2: In the second year, students build upon year one's foundation, gaining more advanced skills in areas such as antenatal and postnatal care. Specific modules might focus on risk management, complications during pregnancy and childbirth, and newborn assessments.  Clinical placements become increasingly challenging, providing more diverse and complex care settings and situations.  Students are expected to increase their independence in assessing and performing care, while maintaining rigorous patient safety standards and continuing to practice interprofessional communication.  The second year includes more in-depth modules on the care of women with various health conditions.
Year 3: The third year focuses on advanced midwifery care and specialized skills.  Students might focus on areas like high-risk pregnancies, complex deliveries, and postpartum complications.  They conduct more comprehensive assessments and handle independent clinical decision-making processes.  Further clinical placements might also incorporate leadership, policy, ethics, and management, particularly in relation to improving maternity services. The final year includes a major clinical placement component and advanced leadership skills.

Entry Requirement: This BSc (Hons) in Minerals Management (Top Up) is designed for those already employed within the sector, or recently new to the sector who have a requirement to further develop their skills and knowledge, and progress their career.  Entry requirements include holding a University of Derby Foundation Degree, Diploma in Quarry Technology, Diploma in Asphalt Technology and Quarry Studies top up Certificate, and achieving the SHE NVQ4* (since 2005) or QCF SHE6.  Other equivalent qualifications may be accepted; contact the university to discuss.  Applicants must be employed or affiliated with an employer, nominated by their line manager, and deemed suitable for the program.  The selection process is consistent with equal opportunities policies.  Prospective students must also demonstrate English language proficiency equivalent to a GCSE English Language, IELTS 6.0, or equivalent. They need to complete a university application form. Learners must be 18 years or older.  Pakistan Specific Requirements: The provided text does not contain specific entry requirements for students from Pakistan beyond the general English language and other qualification requirements stated above.  Therefore,  the standard requirements of the University are applicable for Pakistani students.
Overview: The BSc (Hons) Minerals Management (Top-Up) is a part-time, two-year degree designed for professionals in the mineral products industry.
